181.description: Revises provision relating to license classification of distributors licensed to sell & distribute alcoholic beverages for resale to specified persons; authorizes distributors to purchase or acquire certain alcoholic beverages from licensed vendors; provides that such vendor may not be classified as distributor under Beverage Law; requires distributors to maintain record of purchases & acquisitions; requires distributors to report certain information on monthly excise tax report; revises provision relating to license classification of vendors licensed to sell alcoholic beverages to specified persons; provides that sales by vendors to specified distributors are exempt from sales tax collection at point of sale.

183.title: Offenses Evidencing Prejudice
183.description: Designates act "Carl's Law"; removes provisions relating to reclassification of offenses committed while evidencing prejudice based on mental or physical disability of victim from provisions relating to offenses evidencing prejudice generally & reenacts them in separate statute section.

184.title: Construction Liens
184.description: Provides that lessor's interest in commercial property is not subject to construction lien for construction, renovation, or improvement made by lessee under certain conditions.

185.last_action: Died in Government Operations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 592 (Ch. 2016-159)
185.title: Pub. Rec./Emergency Medical Technicians or Paramedics
185.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain identifying information of current or former emergency medical technicians or paramedics certified under ch. 401, F.S.; provides for future legislative review and repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

186.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 540 (Ch. 2016-189)
186.title: Estates
186.description: Provides determination of disposition of real property; authorizes payment of attorney fees & costs from trust assets; requires trustee serve written notice of intent upon qualified beneficiary before payment; requires notice be served in specified manner with specified information; provides qualified beneficiaries are entitled to refund of payment; requires award of attorney fees & costs in; prohibits trustee from using trust assets for payment; authorizes order compelling return of attorney fees & costs to trust with interest; requires court deny motion unless was breach of trust; authorizes court to deny motion; authorizes movant to show that reasonable basis exists & trustee to rebut showing; imposes remedies or sanctions; authorizes trustee use trust assets in specified manner; specifies proceedings, remedies, & rights are not limited.

187.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
187.title: Utility Advanced Cost Recovery
187.description: Provides for expiration of advanced cost recovery for nuclear & integrated gasification combined cycle power plants; requires certain funds to be returned to ratepayers; prohibits utilities from imposing charges to offset loss of utility revenues as result of refunding moneys from collection of advanced cost recovery fees; provides for future repeal.

188.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
188.title: Intimate Apparel
188.description: Prohibits retail stores from allowing customer to try on intimate apparel in store unless it is tried on over clothing or with disposable shield; prohibits retail store from selling intimate apparel that has been tried on in violation of the prohibition.

189.title: Protection of Religious Freedom
189.description: Provides immunity from liability for health care facility, health care provider, person, closely held organization, religious institution, business owned or operated by religious institution, or private child-placing agency that refuses to perform certain actions that would be contrary to religious or moral convictions or policies.

190.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 232 (Ch. 2016-40)
190.title: Guardianship
190.description: Renames Statewide Public Guardianship Office as Office of Public & Professional Guardians; revises duties & responsibilities of executive director for Office of Public & Professional Guardians; provides that guardian has standing to seek judicial review pursuant to ch. 120, F.S., if his or her registration is denied; requires office to establish disciplinary proceedings, conduct hearings, & take administrative action; provides grounds for discipline, penalties, & procedures for determining which disciplinary action is appropriate for professional guardians; provides appropriation.

191.last_action: Withdrawn prior to introduction, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 716 (Ch. 2016-191)
191.title: Florida Holocaust Memorial
191.description: Establishes Florida Holocaust Memorial; provides for administration by DMS, prohibits DMS from constructing & placing memorial until certain conditions are met.

192.title: Secondary Metals Recyclers
192.description: Revises term "appropriate law enforcement official" to include an agent for purposes of provisions regulating secondary metals recyclers.

193.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
193.title: Sales of Tax Certificates for Unpaid Taxes
193.description: Prohibits certain bidders from placing multiple bids during sale of certain tax certificates by tax collectors; authorizes individual counties to set interest rate on real property taxes; requires each county to set interest rate on tax certificates annually; establishes interest rate for certain tax delinquencies.

194.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1046 (Ch. 2016-115)
194.title: Farm Vehicles
194.description: Provides exemptions for covered farm vehicles & operators of such vehicles from specified federal regulations relating to controlled substances & alcohol use & testing, commercial driver licenses, physical qualifications & examinations, hours of service of drivers, & inspection, repair, & maintenance when operating under certain conditions.

195.title: Title Insurance
195.description: Revises certain limitations on assumption of risk by title insurers; authorizes title insurer to obtain reinsurance from eligible reinsurer; revises applicability.

196.last_action: Died in Government Operations Appropriations Subcommittee
196.title: Point-of-sale Terminals
196.description: Authorizes Department of Lottery to create program that authorizes certain persons to purchase ticket or game at point-of-sale terminal that process credit & debit cards issued by financial institutions & retailers.

197.title: Highlands Road and Bridge District, Pasco County
197.description: Abolishes Highlands Road and Bridge District, repeals special acts relating to district; transfers assets & liabilities to Pasco County.

198.title: Reimbursement of Medicaid Providers
198.description: Defines "usual and customary charge" for purposes of Medicaid billing; provides applicability.

199.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-224, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 221 (Ch. 2016-222), CS/HB 977 (Ch. 2016-231), HB 1241 (Ch. 2016-145)
199.title: Access to Health Care Services
199.description: Expanding the categories of persons who may prescribe brand name drugs under the prescription drug program when medically necessary; requiring advanced registered nurse practitioners and physician assistants who prescribe controlled substances for the treatment of certain pain to make a certain designation, comply with registration requirements, and follow specified standards of practice; designates "The Barbara Lumpkin Prescribing Act", etc.

200.title: State-leased Space
200.description: Revises requirements for DMS rules relating to terms & conditions included in lease agreements in which state is lessee; provides applicability.

201.title: Recreational Vessel Registration
201.description: Provides reduced recreational vessel registration fee schedule for vessels registered during specified period which are equipped with emergency position indicating radio beacon or for which owner of vessel owns personal locator beacon; limits application to one vessel per owner; authorizes DHSMV to adopt rules relating to proof of qualification; provides for certain funds to supplement reduced amounts collected; provides for expiration of reduced fee schedule; revises provisions relating to Marine Resources Conservation Trust Fund; provides for use of supplemental funds; revises provisions relating to county & municipality optional registration fees; specifies that reduced fees do not apply to limitation on registration fees charged by county.

202.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 184 (Ch. 2016-242)
202.title: Military and Veterans Affairs
202.description: Requires application form for original, renewal, or replacement driver licenses or identification cards to include option for veterans to request information on local, state, & federal benefits & services available as result of military service; requires DHSMV to report veteran contact information monthly to DVA; requires DVA to provide such information to third-party provider & county or city veteran service officers; prohibits third-party provider from selling such information; requires third-party provider to maintain confidentiality of information; creates Military & Overseas Voting Assistance Task Force within DOS.

203.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-83, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 535 (Ch. 2016-129)
203.title: Fire Safety
203.description: Revises provisions relating to certain structures located on agricultural property which are exempt from Florida Fire Prevention Code; requires that certain structures used for agritourism activity be classified; provides criteria for such classifications; provides that certain structures are subject to annual inspection; specifies applicable fire prevention standards; requires that State Fire Marshal adopt rules; revises certain dimensions of tent that is exempt from code; requires that State Fire Marshal adopt rules; authorizes local fire official to consider specified publication when identifying an alternative to firesafety code.

204.title: Florida Retirement System
204.description: Requires SBA to identify any Iran-restricted companies, Sudan-restricted companies, & companies that boycott Israel; authorizes FRS to cease divesting from companies under certain conditions; exempts SBA from certain conflicting obligations under general law; provides legislative intent.

205.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 88 (Ch. 2016-182)
205.title: Gold Star License Plates
205.description: Revises qualifications for receipt of Gold Star license plate to include certain relatives of fallen servicemembers.

206.title: Certificates of Need for Hospitals
206.description: Deletes provisions relating to certificates of need required for new, expanded, or modified hospital construction; revises AHCA's rulemaking authority with respect to hospitals that provide certain services.

207.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-127, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 12 (Ch. 2016-241)
207.title: Mental Health Services in the Criminal Justice System
207.description: Expanding eligibility for military veterans and servicemembers court programs; authorizing the creation of treatment-based mental health court programs; creating the Forensic Hospital Diversion Pilot Program; authorizing courts to order certain offenders on probation or community control to postadjudicatory mental health court programs, etc.

208.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
208.title: Capital Formation for Infrastructure Projects
208.description: Includes infrastructure funding in legislative findings & intent relating to need for seed capital & venture equity capital for emerging companies; provides for Florida Opportunity Fund to facilitate creation of private, for-profit limited partnership or limited liability partnership & provides duties, requirements, procedures, & applicability thereto; provides for creation of state beneficiary public trust & duties, requirements, procedures, & applicability thereto; provides for issuance of contingent state bonds by DOR & exempts such bonds from specified securities transaction regulation; authorizes DOR to share information regarding such bonds.

209.title: Advanced International Certificate of Education Funding
209.description: Provides requirements related to allocation & use of certain funds; authorizes maximum bonus of $3,000 for Advanced International Certificate of Education teachers under certain circumstances.

210.title: Viatical Settlements
210.description: Revises provisions concerning viatical settlement providers; adds act that warrants imposition of administrative penalties against viatical settlement provider licensees; specifies procedures, authorized acts, & prohibited acts related to execution of viatical settlement contracts; provides criminal penalties for violation of such prohibitions; specifies authorized & prohibited acts by insurers related to viatical settlement providers; provides that certain agreements & transactions relating to stranger-originated life insurance practices are void & unenforceable.

211.title: Local Government Environmental Financing
211.description: Citing this act as the "Florida Keys Stewardship Act"; expanding the uses of local government infrastructure surtaxes to include acquiring any interest in land for public recreation, conservation, or protection of natural resources or to prevent or satisfy private property rights claims resulting from limitations imposed by the designation of an area of critical state concern; expanding the use of Everglades restoration bonds to include the City of Key West Area of Critical State Concern; authorizing bond proceeds to be spent on the City of Key West Area of Critical State Concern; requiring specific Florida Forever appropriations to be used for the purchase of lands in the Florida Keys Area of Critical State Concern, etc.

212.title: Restoration of Civil Rights
212.description: Designates act as "Restoration of Civil Rights Act"; provides for automatic restoration of former felon's civil rights, other than right to own, possess, or use firearms, following completion of his or her sentence of incarceration & community supervision; provides conditions for & exemptions from automatic restoration; provides for education concerning civil rights of people who have felony convictions; provides retroactive applicability; provides for contingent effect.

213.title: Alimony
213.description: Requires use of specified factors in calculating alimony pendente lite; provides presumptions concerning alimony awards depending on duration of marriages; provides for imputation of income in certain circumstances; declares public policy concerning child's interests regarding time sharing in custody & support proceedings; prohibits court from changing duration of alimony award; provides for motions to advance trial of certain actions if specified period has passed since initial service on respondent.

214.title: Drones
214.description: Provides for liability for damage to person or property in this state for which operation of drone was substantial contributing factor.

215.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 416 (Ch. 2016-44)
215.title: Location of Utilities
215.description: Revises circumstances under which county commissioners may grant license for specified projects related to lines for transmission of certain public utilities & communication services; authorizes DOT & certain local governmental entities to prescribe & enforce regulations regarding placement & maintenance of specified structures & lines within right-of-way limits of roads or publicly owned rail corridors; specifies that owner of utility located within certain right-of-way limits must initiate & bear cost necessary to alleviate any interference to use of certain public roads or rail corridors; requires authority to bear cost of utility work necessary to eliminate unreasonable interference if utility is lawfully located within certain utility easement, subject to certain deductions; provides findings of important state interest.

216.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 592 (Ch. 2016-159)
216.title: Public Records/Unsworn DFS Investigative Personnel
216.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of certain unsworn investigative personnel of DFS & names & personal identifying & location information of spouses & children of such personnel; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

217.title: Health Maintenance Organization Solvency
217.description: Redefines term "life & health insurer" to include HMOs authorized only in this state; specifies limitation on premium to surplus ratio of HMO; provides formulas for calculation; specifies requirements for projected annual gross written premium; defines "gross written premium"; requires OIR to take certain actions with respect to HMO if specified premium to surplus ratio is exceeded; provides an exception; provides applicability; provides directive to Division of Law Revision & Information.

218.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 828 (Ch. 2016-170)
218.title: Insurance Guaranty Association Assessments
218.description: Requires OIR to levy assessments for certain purposes; revises & providing requirements for levy of assessments; requires insurers & self-insurance funds to report certain premiums; requires insurers to collect policy surcharges & pay assessments to association; revises requirements for reporting premium for assessment calculations; revises & providing requirements & limitations for remittance of assessments to association.

219.title: Human Trafficking
219.description: Requires certain licensing boards to require continuing education course on human trafficking for specified licensees; provides requirements & procedures related to course; provides that failure to complete course is grounds for disciplinary action; provides penalties; provides rulemaking authority.

220.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 586 (Ch. 2016-113)
220.title: Responsibilities of Health Care Providers
220.description: Repeals provisions relating to practice parameters for physicians performing caesarean section deliveries in provider hospitals; requires hospital to notify certain obstetrical physicians within specified timeframe before hospital closes its obstetrical department or ceases to provide obstetrical services.

221.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 854 (Ch. 2016-172)
221.title: Funeral, Cemetery, and Consumer Services
221.description: Revises licensing requirements for funeral, cemetery & consumer services; revises actions subject to disciplinary action; requires Division of Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services to authorize specified rules for preneed contracts; revises requirements related to care & maintenance trust funds & unitrust distribution method; revises requirements & restrictions related to preneed contract.

222.title: Public Records/Identity of Witness to a Murder
222.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of witness to murder for specified period; authorizes specified entities to receive information; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides that public records exemption applies to personal identifying information of witness to murder that is made part of court file; provides statement of public necessity.

223.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
223.title: Hospital Districts
223.description: Defines "hospital district"; requires decennial reauthorization of taxing authority of certain hospital districts; prohibits hospital districts from levying property tax without consent of electors residing within hospital district; terminates taxing authority of hospital district if referenda are not approved by majority vote of electors; provides for allocation of hospital district assets & liabilities; provides requirements for creation, expansion, or combination of certain hospital districts; requires certain public hospitals to prepare economic analysis; specifies that hospital taxing district taxes be paid to district rather than community redevelopment area.

224.title: Special Districts
224.description: Revising legislative intent with respect to the Uniform Special District Accountability Act to include dependent special districts; specifying the Legislature's authority to create dependent special districts by special act; providing for the identification of a dependent special district as dependent and an independent special district as independent in its charter; requiring the Department of Economic Opportunity to exclude inactive special districts from the official list of special districts; specifying that certain dependent special districts may be reviewed by specified local general purpose governments, etc.

225.title: Columbia County Law Library
225.description: Abolishes Columbia County Law Library; transfers library's assets & liabilities to Columbia County.

226.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
226.title: Local Government Neighborhood Improvement Districts
226.description: Authorizes designated representatives of certain property owners to be eligible to serve on board of directors of neighborhood improvement districts.

227.title: Search Warrants
227.description: Specifies that search warrant may be issued by judge with territorial jurisdiction where thing to be searched may be; provides for issuance of search warrants for person's DNA or DNA samples by certain judges; authorizes issuance of search warrants for DNA collection & analysis & for blood analysis in connection with investigation or prosecution of specified offenses; provides exemption from time limits for execution & return of search warrants for warrants authorizing collection & analysis of DNA or DNA samples.

228.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7061 (Ch. 2016-239)
228.title: Persons Who Are Deaf
228.description: Authorizes international symbol for deaf & hard of hearing to be exhibited on driver license or identification card of person who is deaf or hard of hearing; provides applicability.

229.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1318 (Ch. 2016-200)
229.title: Shellfish Harvesting
229.description: Revises provisions directing DACS, in cooperation with FWCC & DEP, to protect specified shellfish beds, grounds, & reefs; provides for harvesting of shellfish from sovereign submerged land leases; provides for Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund to authorize use of dredges or mechanical harvesting devices as special lease conditions; provides penalties for certain prohibited use & possession of such dredges or mechanical harvesting devices; removes provisions relating to shellfish harvesting seasons & removal of oysters, clams, or mussels from natural reefs; authorizes, rather than requires, DACS to designate areas for taking of oysters clams to be planted on public lands; specifies that FWCC, rather than DACS, shall establish the amount of oysters, clams, & mussels that may be relayed or transplanted; removes provisions relating to dredging of dead shells & oyster culture.

230.title: Water and Wastewater
230.description: Requires Division of Bond Finance to review certain private activity bonds; exempts sales & leases to certain water utilities from sales tax; exempts from regulation person who resells water to certain entities;

231.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee
231.title: Rental Car Companies
231.description: Prohibits rental car company from charging fee for payment of toll amounts.

232.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 202 (Ch. 2016-30)
232.title: Florida Association of Centers for Independent Living
232.description: Requires specified agreement to be maintained; requiring program to provide additional support & services; requiring program to reimburse Florida Association of Centers for Independent Living for certain costs approved by Advisory and Oversight Committee; revising maximum amount of specified funds for each state attorney which may be used to administer personal attendant & employment assistance program & to contract with state attorneys participating in tax collection enforcement diversion program.

233.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 288 (Ch. 2016-243)
233.title: State Designations
233.description: Provides honorary designation of certain state park in specified county; directs DEP to erect suitable markers.

234.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-128, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62)
234.title: Ad Valorem Taxation
234.description: Revising procedures for the revision of an erroneous or incomplete personal property tax return; requiring a property appraiser to serve a notice of intent to record a notice of tax lien under certain circumstances; revising the entities authorized to determine under certain circumstances that a petitioner owes ad valorem taxes or is owed a refund of overpaid taxes; revising requirements for an entity that may represent a taxpayer before the value adjustment board, etc.

235.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 190 (Ch. 2016-110)
235.title: Conservation Easements
235.description: Deletes requirement that exemption for conservation easement must be renewed annually; provides that property owner is not required to file renewal application until use of property no longer complies with conservation easement requirements or restrictions.

236.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1042 (Ch. 2016-33)
236.title: Judgments
236.description: Provides definitions for purposes of ch. 56, F.S.; revises terminology; provides that execution is valid & effective during life of order on which it is issued; specifies that persons to whom Notice to Appear has been issued may obtain possession of property levied on by complying with certain procedures; provides for issuance of Notice to Appear; provides for fraudulent transfer claims; provides for discovery in proceedings supplementary.

237.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 666 (Ch. 2016-167)
237.title: Voter Identification
237.description: Expands list of acceptable forms of identification for certain voter registration applicants & for identification at polls, to include veteran health identification cards & licenses to carry concealed weapon or firearm.

238.title: Warrantless Arrests
238.description: Permits law enforcement officer to rely on information received from first responder at scene of traffic crash to arrest person for specified violations without warrant.

240.title: Special License Plates
240.description: Requires moneys received from sale of Woman Veteran license plates to be used for certain purposes; provides for special license plate to be issued to recipient of Bronze Star; allows Prisoner of War Medal on "Ex-POW" license plate.

243.title: Certificates of Public Convenience and Necessity for Life Support or Air Ambulance Services
243.description: Requires counties to include recommendations of specified districts when developing standards for certificates of public convenience & necessity; provides exemption for certain governmental agencies; requires specified county governing bodies to adopt or amend ordinance to provide standards for issuance of certificates by certain date; requires such counties to adopt review process; provides appeal process; provides applicability.

244.title: Gilchrist County Development Authority
244.description: Abolishes Gilchrist County Development Authority; transfers district's assets & liabilities to Gilchrist County.

245.title: Mammography Reports
245.description: Requires that mammography reports include specified notice regarding breast density.

246.title: Voter List Maintenance
246.description: Revises requirements for notice of registered voter's potential ineligibility published in newspaper of general circulation to include voter's party affiliation; requires that such notices be posted on supervisor's website; revises components of supervisor's certification provided to DOS to require party affiliation statistics of voters removed from statewide voter registration system.

247.title: Small Community Sewer Construction Assistance Act
247.description: Revises definition of term "financially disadvantaged small community" to include counties & special districts; defines term "special district."

248.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 86 (Ch. 2016-36)
248.title: Scrutinized Companies
248.description: Establishes reporting requirements for executive director of SBA regarding companies boycotting Israel; requires SBA to identify companies in which public moneys are invested that are conducting businesses that boycott Israel; requires SBA to create & maintain certain scrutinized companies lists that name all such companies; requires SBA to divest of all publicly traded securities of scrutinized company under certain conditions; providing reporting requirements; prohibiting local governmental entities from entering into contracts with companies on scrutinized list.

249.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee
249.title: Freight Mobility and Trade Projects
249.description: Provides for certain fees collected by DHSMV to be set aside for specified freight mobility & trade projects or navigational channel projects.

250.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 708 (Ch. 2016-163)
250.title: Arthur G. Dozier School for Boys
250.description: Requires certain historical resources, records, archives, artifacts, researches, medical records, & human remains to remain in custody of USF; provides for location of next of kin of children buried at Arthur G. Dozier School for Boys; provides for reimbursement of next of kin of children whose bodies were recovered at school or for payment directly to provider for certain costs; provides that charitable donation made toward such expenses is not eligible for reimbursement; authorizes DOS to adopt rules; establishes task force to make recommendations regarding memorial & location of site for reinterment of unidentified or unclaimed remains; provides appropriations.

251.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-129, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 431 (Ch. 2016-83)
251.title: Building Codes
251.description: Revises provisions related to Florida Building Code; revises provisions regarding Florida Building Code Compliance and Mitigation Program; restricts application of Florida Building Code for certain aspects of construction; revises provisions related to portable pools; revises provisions regarding Florida Homeowners' Construction Recovery Fund; revises minimum requirements for certificate of completion for residential swimming pools; revises provisions regarding authority of building officials to issue building permits; revises provisions regarding appeal boards; revising provisions addressing certain fire service access elevators; creates task force to study electrical safety in swimming pools; creates construction industry workforce task force to study issues associated with training of construction workforce.

252.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
252.title: Wireless Communications Devices
252.description: Provides for primary enforcement of Florida Ban on Texting While Driving Law.

253.title: Addresses of Legal Residence
253.description: Defining the term "address of legal residence"; requiring a voter registration application to include the applicant's address of legal residence and certain additional distinguishing information; specifying that an applicant's failure to include such distinguishing information on a voter registration application does not affect his or her qualifications to register or vote or cast a ballot; providing that a list of valid addresses maintained by a supervisor of elections include certain additional distinguishing information, etc.

254.title: Small Group Health Insurance
254.description: Revises health benefit plan requirements relating to small employers.

256.title: Practice of Pharmacy
256.description: Creates "Access to Pharmacist Services Act"; provides responsibilities of consultant pharmacist & doctors of pharmacy; provides for payment or reimbursement for certain pharmacist services.

257.title: Offenses Concerning Racketeering and Illegal Debts
257.description: Authorizes investigative agency to institute civil proceeding for forfeiture in circuit court in certain circumstances; revises grounds for an action; authorizes court to order forfeiture of other property of defendant up to value of unavailable property in certain circumstances; authorizes DLA to bring an action for certain violations; provides for civil penalties for natural persons & other persons; authorizes party to specific civil action to petition for entry of consent decree or settlement agreement & provides requirements; revises provisions relating to subpoena confidentiality; provides that investigative agency has authority to stipulate to protective orders with respect to documents & information submitted in response to subpoena; provides for distribution of forfeiture proceeds to victims.

258.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7099 (Ch. 2016-220)
258.title: Aviation Fuel Taxes
258.description: Revises eligibility criteria for wholesalers & terminal suppliers to receive refunds or credits of previously paid excise taxes; provides for future repeal; revises rate of excise tax on certain aviation fuels.

259.title: Family Law
259.description: Creates presumption that approximately equal time-sharing by both parents is in best interest of child; revises finite list of factors that court must evaluate when determining whether presumption of approximately equal time-sharing is overcome; requires court order to be supported by written findings of fact; prohibits determination of parental responsibility, parenting plan, or time-sharing schedule unless certain determinations are made.

260.title: Driving Under the Influence
260.description: Requires mandatory placement, at convicted person's sole expense, of ignition interlock device for specified period for first DUI conviction; removes obsolete provisions.

261.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
261.title: Vulnerable Adults
261.description: Provides for cause of action against exploitation of vulnerable adults by facility providing goods & services to such vulnerable adults.

262.title: Self-service Storage Facilities
262.description: Provides that advertisement of sale or disposition of property may be advertised on website developed by DFS & CFO; limits liability of CFO; provides that lien sale may be conducted on certain websites; provides that self-service storage facility owner is not required to have license to post property for online sale; deletes required alternative form of advertisement; provides limits for maximum valuation of property; provides options for disposition of motor vehicles or watercraft claimed to be subject to lien; requires specified notice to lienholders & owners of motor vehicles or watercraft subject to lien; requires DFS & CFO to develop, operate, & maintain Internet website for certain purposes; provides for establishment & deposit of fees to cover costs of website; provides rulemaking authority.

263.title: Organizational Structure of the Department of Environmental Protection
263.description: Establishes Office of the Secretary within DEP; authorizes Secretary of Environmental Protection to establish offices within the office & within department's divisions to promote efficient & effective operation of DEP; directs secretary to appoint general counsel; removes required establishment of certain offices; establishes Division of Water Restoration Assistance within DEP.

264.title: Public Assistance
264.description: Revises eligibility guidelines for Relative Caregiver Program; requires DCF to impose replacement fee for EBT cards; revises penalties for noncompliance with work requirements for temporary cash assistance; limits receipt of child-only benefits during periods of noncompliance; requires DCF to refer sanctioned participants to appropriate community services; revises consideration of income from illegal or ineligible noncitizen family members in determining eligibility for temporary cash assistance; requires DEO to develop & implement work plan agreement for participants in temporary cash assistance program.

265.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 194 (Ch. 2016-155)
265.title: Redevelopment Trust Fund
265.description: Adding certain hospital districts to list of public bodies or taxing authorities that are exempt from appropriating certain revenues to a redevelopment trust fund.

266.title: Specialty License Plates/Professional Sports Teams
266.description: Provides annual use fees for Orlando City Soccer Club & Jacksonville Armada Football Club specialty license plates; & additional entities eligible for Florida Professional Sports Teams license plate; requires DHSMV to develop Orlando City Soccer Club license plate & Jacksonville Armada Football Club license plate.

267.title: Disclosure of Call Location Information
267.description: Defines "covered service"; requires provider of covered service to furnish user's call location information to law enforcement agency or to public safety answering point on behalf of law enforcement agency; requires request for call location information to be accompanied by supporting sworn written statement; prohibits governmental entity from action against provider or carrier that acts in good faith; requires law enforcement agency to request court order within certain timeframe; requires FDLE to obtain & distribute specified information to law enforcement agencies & public safety answering points.

268.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
268.title: Music Therapists
268.description: Establishes requirements for registration as music therapist; requires biennial renewal of registration; prohibits practice of music therapy unless registered; provides exemptions to registration; authorizes DOH to adopt rules & take disciplinary action against an applicant or registrant who violates act.

269.title: Allocation of Court Costs
269.description: Removes fixed allocations of proceeds of specified additional court cost & authorizes county commissioners to allocate such proceeds for specified purposes; provides county commissioners with discretion concerning allocation of additional court cost proceeds carried forward to next fiscal year.

270.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
270.title: Education Funding Tax Reform
270.description: Replaces revenue from required local effort education property tax with revenue from education sales & use tax; provides for levy of education sales & use tax; specifies tax rate & use of proceeds; exempts retail sale of certain used tangible personal property from sales & use tax; directs DOR to petition for state's full membership in Streamlined Sales & Use Tax Agreement.

271.title: Liability Insurance Coverage
271.description: Adds company employee adjusters to list of persons who may respond to claimant's written request for information relating to liability insurance coverage.

272.title: Municipal Power Regulation
272.description: Requires certain entities created under Interlocal Cooperation Act of 1969 to submit financial statements for certain electric power projects to specified public entities.

273.title: State Veterans' Nursing Homes
273.description: Directs DVA to contract for study to determine need for additional state veterans' nursing home & most appropriate county for home; directs DVA to submit study to Governor & Legislature; provides study criteria for ranking each county according to need; requires DVA to use specified studies to select new veterans' nursing home sites; directs DVA to conduct subsequent studies & to submit studies to Governor & Legislature.

274.title: Provision of Pharmaceutical Services
274.description: Provides requirements for health insurers & HMOs with respect to insureds or subscribers with HIV; requires that insureds or subscribers with HIV be allowed to access pharmaceutical services at network retail pharmacy or out-of-network retail pharmacy credentialed by insurer; provides for credentialing application fee; provides for cost sharing by insured or subscriber; provides for reimbursement to health insurer or HMO.

275.title: Instruction for Homebound and Hospitalized Students
275.description: Requires school districts to provide instruction to homebound or hospitalized students; provides for student eligibility, methods of providing instruction to homebound or hospitalized students, & initiation of services.

276.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 752 (Ch. 2016-164)
276.title: Public Records/Agency Inspector General Personnel
276.description: Provides public records exemption for certain information of current or former personnel & spouses & children of such personnel employed in agency's office of inspector general or internal audit department whose duties include auditing or investigating certain activities that could lead to criminal prosecution or administrative discipline.

277.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-130, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62), CS/SB 922 (Ch. 2016-174)
277.title: Environmental Control
277.description: Repealing provisions relating to violations of consumptive use permit conditions; providing conditions under which certain constructed clay settling areas are exempt from reclamation rate and financial responsibility requirements; requiring Florida registered professionals to certify that certain stormwater management systems will meet additional requirements for a general permit, etc.

278.title: Laser Hair Removal
278.description: Provides certification & training requirements for electrologists who use laser or pulsed-light devices in hair removal.

279.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 479 (Ch. 2016-22), CS/CS/CS/HB 651 (Ch. 2016-132), CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237), HB 7071 (Ch. 2016-151)
279.title: Government Accountability
279.description: Requiring each house of the Legislature to provide by rule reporting requirements regarding a lobbying firm's lobbying activities; requiring certain elected municipal officers to file a full and public disclosure of financial interests, rather than a statement of financial interests; requiring counties, municipalities, and special districts to maintain certain budget documents on the entities' websites for a specified period; repealing provisions which provide for the creation and administration of the Florida State Employees' Charitable Campaign, etc.

280.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 580 (Ch. 2016-158)
280.title: Reimbursement to Health Access Settings for Dental Hygiene Services for Children
280.description: Authorizes reimbursement for children's dental services provided by licensed dental hygienists in health access setting.

281.title: Missing Person Investigations
281.description: Revises definition of term "missing endangered person"; provides that certain persons are immune from civil liability for damages for complying with request to release Lime Alert information to appropriate agencies; provides presumption that certain persons & entities recording, reporting, transmitting, displaying, or releasing such information acted in good faith; specifies that only law enforcement agency having jurisdiction over case may request that Missing Endangered Persons Information Clearinghouse activate state Lime Alert involving missing person who is suspected by law enforcement agency of meeting criteria for activation of Lime Alert Plan.

282.title: Child Welfare
282.description: Extends court jurisdiction to age 22 for young adults with disabilities in foster care; provides conditions under which child may be returned home with in-home safety plan; requires specified intervention services & supports; requires child of certain age to be consulted on development of his or her case plan; requires lead agencies to ensure availability of full array of family support services.

283.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
283.title: Employment Practices
283.description: Requires employer to allow employee to take paid family care leave for certain purposes; provides employee requirements; specifies limitations & duties with respect to employer's administration of family care leave; provides family care leave requirements; provides responsibilities and powers of DEO; provides penalty for employer's failure to comply with certain requirements; authorizes employee to bring civil action against employer for violation within specified timeframe; authorizes award of specified compensation, damages, & fees; provides protections for employee who acts in good faith; prohibits employee from taking certain actions in bad faith; provides penalty; authorizes department to adopt rules; revises Florida Civil Rights Act of 1992 to prohibit specified employment practices; provides certain rights for employee who is disabled from pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition; reenacts & revises provisions relating to administrative & civil remedies for violations of Florida Civil Rights Act of 1992.

284.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 535 (Ch. 2016-129)
284.title: Applications for Building Permits
284.description: Requires counties & local enforcement agencies to post all types of building permit applications on their websites; specifies format in which completed applications must be submitted & format in which payments, attachments, & drawings may be submitted.

285.last_action: Died in Government Operations Appropriations Subcommittee
285.title: State Lottery
285.description: Provides limitation on number of scratch-off games available for sale by Department of the Lottery at any one time; provides limitation on price of lottery tickets.

286.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
286.title: Homestead Property Tax Exemptions
286.description: Removes requirement that deceased veteran must have resided in this state on specified date before ad valorem tax exemption for homestead property may apply to veteran's surviving spouse; exempts unremarried surviving spouse of certain deceased veterans from payment of ad valorem taxes for certain homestead property in this state, irrespective of state in which veteran's homestead was located at time of death, if certain conditions are met.

287.title: Workers' Compensation System Administration
287.description: Deletes required item to be listed on notice of election to be exempt; revises specified rules regarding maintenance of business records by an officer of corporation; provides and removes duties of DFS; prohibits application of specified credit unless employer provides specified documentation & proof of payment to department within specified period; revises penalty calculation for imputed weekly payroll for an employee; eliminates certification requirements when expert medical advisor is selected by judge of compensation claims; deletes requirement that employers notify department within 24 hours of any injury resulting in death; revises requirements for filing claim; deletes preferred worker program; deletes notification fees on certain filed claims which supplement Special Disability Trust Fund; deletes fee for certain registration of insurance carriers.

288.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 12 (Ch. 2016-241)
288.title: Parenting Plans
288.description: Provides that parenting plan that provides for shared parental responsibility over health care decisions must authorize either parent to consent to mental health treatment for child.

289.title: Pediatric Cardiac Advisory Council
289.description: Requires DOH to appoint cardiac advisory council for specified purposes; specifies duties & composition of council; provides appointments & term limits for council; prohibits employee of department from serving on council; prohibits council members from receiving compensation; provides exception for per diem & travel expenses; requires council meetings to be conducted by teleconference where that capability is available.

290.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
290.title: Employment of Felons
290.description: Provides local business tax credit for employment of person previously convicted of felony; provides requirements to receive credit; provides exceptions for certain felons.

291.title: First Responders
291.description: Requires state agencies to establish first responder career development plan for certain purposes; provides duties of agencies relating to implementation of plan.

293.title: Student Discipline
293.description: Revises definition of "suspension"; requires school districts to establish success centers for students who receive out-of-school suspension; provides requirements for success centers & teachers assigned to success centers; authorizes certain students be assigned to success centers.

294.title: Community Contribution Tax Credits
294.description: Defines terms related to community contribution tax credits that may apply against certain tax liabilities.

295.title: Medicaid Managed Care
295.description: Provides additional eligibility criteria for certain persons to qualify for medical assistance payments; authorizes AHCA to apply for & implement additional state plan amendments & federal waivers to implement Medicaid managed care program; deletes requirement that agency hold public meetings; exempts certain Medicaid recipients from mandatory enrollment in managed care plans; requires Medicaid managed care plans to establish alternative benefit plans; provides supplemental plan selection process for certain Medicaid recipients; directs agency to provide notice of invitations to negotiate by specified date.

296.title: Campaign Financing Reports
296.description: Requires campaign finance report to specify purpose of expenditure made by or on behalf of political committee.

297.title: Public Food Service Establishments
297.description: Revises definition of term "public food service establishment" to exclude certain events; clarifies that food service license is not required if event is excluded under definition of term "public food service establishment."

298.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
298.title: Social Media Privacy
298.description: Prohibits employer from requesting or requiring access to social media account of employee or prospective employee; prohibits employer from taking retaliatory personnel action against employee as result of employee's refusal to allow access to his or her social media account; prohibits employer from failing or refusing to hire prospective employee as result of prospective employee's refusal to allow access to his or her social media account; authorizes civil action for violation; provides penalty for violation; provides for recovery of attorney fees & court costs; specifies that employer is not prohibited from seeking access to social media accounts used primarily for employer's business purposes.

299.title: Public Lodging Establishments
299.description: Revises provisions to prohibit operators of public lodging establishments from refusing accommodations to persons based solely upon their age.

300.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
300.title: Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Existing Stationary Sources
300.description: Provides legislative findings regarding federal Clean Air Act regulations that limit certain carbon dioxide emissions; prohibits certain entities from implementing certain rules or submitting certain plans regarding carbon dioxide emissions from existing stationary sources before occurrence of specified events; authorizes DEP to request extension for submitting certain implementation plans.

301.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 772 (Ch. 2016-166), CS/SB 754 (Ch. 2016-161)
301.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
301.description: Revises composition of Board of Professional Surveyors & Mappers; waives specified license & registration fees for honorably discharged veterans of U.S. Armed Forces, spouses of such veterans, or business entities that have majority ownership held by such veterans or spouses of such veterans; requires certain license application for private investigative, private security, & repossession services to include payment of fingerprint processing retention fees; revises firearm & weapons training certification requirements for certain licenses; directs FDLE to retain certain fingerprints & to enter such fingerprints into statewide automated biometric identification system & national retained print arrest notification program; directs DACS to provide such information to certain employers; prohibits use of mail drop as principal location of commercial telephone sellers; provides requirements for travel documents provided by sellers of travel; exempts certain amusement rides from certain safety standards; requires firearm course instructors to maintain records attesting to use of live fire; reduces initial & renewal fees for concealed weapon licenses; provides for certain notice of suspension or revocation of concealed weapon or firearm license or suspension of processing application; requires affidavit for concealed weapon or firearm license renewals; authorizes certain tax collector offices to accept renewal applications for & deliver concealed weapon or firearm licenses; provides an appropriation.

302.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 754 (Ch. 2016-161), CS/CS/SB 772 (Ch. 2016-166)
302.title: Pub. Rec./Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
302.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for

303.last_action: Died in Regulatory Affairs Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 698 (Ch. 2016-190)
303.title: Alcoholic Beverage Permits
303.description: Exempts railroad transit stations from regulations for time which alcoholic beverages may be sold, served, & consumed; provides for operators of railroad transit stations to obtain licenses to sell alcoholic beverages at such stations; exempts railroad transit stations from liquor bottle size restrictions; exempts operators of restaurants, shops, or other facilities that are part of, or that serve, railroad transit stations from certain licensing regulations; authorizes alcoholic beverages to be served in all areas within property of railroad transit station.

304.title: Public Records/Voters and Voter Registration
304.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for specified information regarding voter or voter registration applicant & information concerning preregistered voter registration applicants; authorizes disclosure of confidential & exempt information; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

305.title: Eagle Bay Sub-Drainage District, Okeechobee County
305.description: Abolishes district; repeals special acts; transfers assets & liabilities of the district.

306.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-132, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 908 (Ch. 2016-165)
306.title: Department of Financial Services
306.description: Authorizing the department to create an Internet-based transmission system to accept service of process; extending the repeal date of an exemption for medical malpractice insurance premiums from certain emergency assessments levied by the Office of Insurance Regulation for the Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund; authorizing service of process by specified means; establishing the Firefighter Assistance Program for certain purposes, etc.

307.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
307.title: Homeowners' Associations
307.description: Renames Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes & Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes Trust Fund; provides that Legislature reserves power to amend or repeal ch. 720, F.S.; requires that homeowners' associations be governed by such amendment or repeal; authorizes division to investigate certain complaints and conduct certain investigations; requires division to adopt penalty guidelines; provides homeowners' association fees; requires written notice of certain board meetings; authorizes homeowners' association to impose certain fines; revises annual meeting requirements; provides requirements for voting by general & limited proxy and board elections & vacancies; revises applicability of certain provisions that relate to transition of association control in community.

308.title: City of Jacksonville, Duval County
308.description: Establishes special zones in downtown Jacksonville; provides exceptions for space & seating requirements for liquor licenses for restaurants in the zones, subject to local zoning requirements.

309.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 860 (Ch. 2016-73)
309.title: Foster Family Appreciation Week
309.description: Designates second week of February of each year as "Foster Family Appreciation Week."

310.title: Automobile Insurance
310.description: Provides exception to provision that deems use of single zip code as rating territory for insurance rates to be unfairly discriminatory; provides duties for OIR concerning such rates; authorizes Florida Automobile JUA & joint underwriting plan approved by OIR to cancel personal lines or commercial policies within specified time for nonpayment of premium due to certain reasons; prohibits insured from cancelling policy or binder within specified time except under certain conditions; requires that certain standard form be approved by office & adopted by FSC, rather than approved by office or adopted by commission; revises standards for compliance for specified billings for medical services; specifies additional entities that may receive reimbursement under Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law regardless of whether they meet specified licensure requirement.

311.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
311.title: Electric, Hybrid, and Hydrogen Vehicles
311.description: Exempts owners of electric, hybrid, & hydrogen vehicles from payment of numerous fees, tolls, & parking violation fees under certain circumstances; exempts sale of certain electric, hybrid, & hydrogen vehicles from sales & use tax.

312.title: Specialty License Plates/Support Our Constitution
312.description: Directs DHSMV to create Support Our Constitution license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; provides for distribution of use fees received from sale of such plates.

313.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
313.title: Community Association Managers
313.description: Renames Regulatory Council of Community Association Managers as Board of Community Association Managers; revises & provides responsibilities relating to board; revises provisions relating to licensure of community association managers & community association management firms, licensure by examination, continuing education, fees, & disciplinary proceedings.

314.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
314.title: Community Associations
314.description: Renames Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes as Division of Common Interest Communities; revises & provides provisions relating to community associations; repeals chapters 719 & 720, F.S., relating to cooperatives & homeowners' associations, respectively.

315.last_action: Died in Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
315.title: Educational Choice
315.description: Provides additional duties of internal auditor for school districts; revises list of public & private educational choice options available to students; requires certain syllabi be provided to parents & contain certain information; requires school districts to provide & publish certain information; revises controlled open enrollment process; requires school district to establish process for parent to request that his or her child be transferred to another classroom teacher; revises components of Credit Acceleration Program; requires DOE to contract with FPU for certain purposes; provides appropriation.

316.title: Prohibited Property Insurance Practices
316.description: Provides grounds for discipline of licensees of various professions & occupations regulated by DBPR.

317.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 590 (Ch. 2016-71)
317.title: Adoption
317.description: Revises circumstances under which adoption consent is valid, binding, & enforceable; requires court to determine, under certain circumstances, whether change of placement of child is in child's best interests, rather than whether change of placement is appropriate.

318.title: Federal Immigration Enforcement
318.description: Designates act "Rule of Law Adherence Act"; requiring state entities, local governmental entities, and law enforcement agencies to comply with and support the enforcement of federal immigration law; prohibiting restrictions by such entities and agencies on taking certain actions with respect to information regarding a person's immigration status; authorizing a law enforcement agency to transport an unauthorized alien under certain circumstances; requiring recordkeeping relating to crime victim and witness cooperation in certain investigations; authorizing local governmental entities and law enforcement agencies to petition the Federal Government for reimbursement of certain costs; requiring the Attorney General to prescribe the format for submitting complaints, etc.

319.title: State Park Fee Discounts for Senior Citizens
319.description: Provides discount on annual entrance passes for certain senior citizens during specified period; directs DEP to report certain information to Governor & Legislature; provides appropriation.

320.title: Public Records/Protective Injunction Petitions
320.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for petitions for certain protective injunctions that are dismissed in certain circumstances & the petitions' contents; provides for removal of petitions dismissed before specified date from publicly accessible records; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

321.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 846 (Ch. 2016-171)
321.title: Divers-down Warning Devices
321.description: Expands types of indicators or devices allowed to be used to signal presence of submerged divers; specifies requirements for such devices.

322.title: Art Therapy
322.description: Creates Advisory Council of Professional Art Therapists within DMQA in DOH; prohibits individual from practicing professional or clinical art therapy unless he or she holds license; establishes requirements for licensure as professional art therapist & clinical art therapist.

323.title: Victim Assistance
323.description: Requiring a law enforcement agency to provide specified information to the victim if a victim's property is located in a pawnshop, etc.

324.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
324.title: Energy Policy
324.description: Restricts manner in which counties & municipalities regulate renewable energy devices; exempts specific entities from PSC regulation; authorizes local renewable energy suppliers to sell local renewable energy to certain end users; specifies conditions under which certain end users may interconnect with local renewable energy suppliers or local electric utilities; provides conditions under which local renewable energy suppliers may interconnect; provides conditions under which net metering provisions apply; restricts declaration of covenants from regulating certain renewable energy devices more stringent than required under Florida Building Code; prohibits enforcement of certain state laws enacted pursuant to federal rules mandating state action under certain circumstances.

325.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
325.title: Discretionary Sales Surtaxes
325.description: Authorizes counties & municipalities within such counties to use local government surtax proceeds & interest for operating purposes; requires reduction in county's or municipality's budget to offset increased revenues from surtax; allows adjustments to county's or municipality's budget for ad valorem tax levy to compensate for reduction in state sales & use tax base.

326.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 938 (Ch. 2016-176)
326.title: Retail Sale of Dextromethorphan
326.description: Prohibits retail sale of finished drug product containing dextromethorphan to person younger than 18 years of age; requires proof of age from purchaser; provides penalties & applicability; preempts local government regulation of dextromethorphan.

327.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
327.title: Florida Seal of Biliteracy Program
327.description: Creates Florida Seal of Biliteracy Program; provides program purpose; provides for administration of program & award of Gold Seal of Biliteracy or Silver Seal of Biliteracy; prohibits DOE & school districts from charging fee for seals; provides for rulemaking.

329.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 100 (Ch. 2016-184)
329.title: Petroleum Restoration Program
329.description: Revises eligibility requirements of Abandoned Tank Restoration Program; revises legislative intent & purpose of Inland Protection Trust Fund; revises the criteria for determining rehabilitation program tasks; revises conditions for eligibility & methods for payment of low-scored site initiative costs; revises eligibility requirements for rehabilitation funding; provides additional funding for remediation & monitoring under certain circumstances; revises advanced cleanup application requirements; increases total amount for which DEP may contract for advanced cleanup work in a fiscal year; authorizes property owners & responsible parties to enter into voluntary cost-share agreements under certain circumstances.

330.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 812 (Ch. 2016-168)
330.title: Reciprocal Insurers
330.description: Authorizes domestic reciprocal insurers to pay portion of unassigned funds to their subscribers; provides limitations.

331.title: Art in the Capitol Competition
331.description: Creates the "Art in the Capitol Competition" for students in specified grades; provides procedures for student participation, notification, & selection & display of winning submissions.

332.title: Vessels
332.description: Provides that vessel overloading or excessive speed constitutes careless operation of vessel; provides for issuance of safety inspection decals; prohibits law enforcement officers from stopping certain vessels solely to inspect for certain compliance; provides exception.

333.title: Qualifications for Educational Interpreters
333.description: Requires SBE to establish standards for educational interpreters & school districts to notify parents if an individual providing interpreter services does not meet SBE standards & report to DOE information regarding individuals providing interpreter services.

334.title: Fantasy Contests
334.description: Provides requirements & procedures for operation of fantasy contests; requires fantasy contest operators to apply for licenses, pay specified fees, & provide specified information; directs DBPR's Division of Regulation to contract for services related to prevention of compulsive or addictive behavior; authorizes division to adopt rules; provides penalties; requires that provisions of chapter 849, F.S., relating to gambling offenses, do not apply to fantasy contest operators or "noncommercial contest operators" as defined by the act; provides applicability.

335.title: City of Tallahassee, Leon County
335.description: Revises boundaries of downtown area for purposes of temporary permits to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises at outdoor events on public right-of-way in downtown area of Tallahassee.

336.title: Consumer Debt Collection
336.description: Revises provisions relating to communication with debtors represented by attorneys; specifies methods by which attorneys representing debtors may provide notice of such representation; prohibits false representations or deceptive or unfair debt collection practices.

337.title: Child Protection Teams
337.description: Revises definition of term "officer, employee, or agent," as it applies to immunity from personal liability in certain actions, to include any member of child protection team, in certain circumstances.

338.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 626 (Ch. 2016-160)
338.title: Consumer Credit
338.description: Authorizes OFR to deny license or take disciplinary action against person who violates Military Lending Act or regulations adopted under act in connection with consumer finance loans, money services, or deferred presentment transaction; prohibits title loan lender, agent, employee, vendor, or affiliated party from violating such act & regulations; authorizes OFR to issue cease & desist order against state financial institution, subsidiary, service corporation, financial institution-affiliated party, or individual for violating such act or regulations adopted under act, to conduct certain investigations, & to seek specified remedies.

339.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-58, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62)
339.title: Education Personnel
339.description: Revises provisions relating to mandatory reports of child abuse, abandonment, & abuse, confidentiality of reports & records in cases of child abuse or neglect, teacher recruitment & retention, educator liability insurance, Education Practices Commission, & complaints against teachers & administrators; requires DOE to approve school leader preparation programs; provides program requirements.

340.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
340.title: Small Business Saturday Sales Tax Holiday
340.description: Provides that tax is not required to be levied on sale of items or articles of tangible personal property by certain small businesses during specified period; provides appropriation.

341.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
341.title: Building Code Enforcment
341.description: Prohibits local government responsible for enforcing Florida Building Code from imposing or enforcing fine, penalty, or lien against property owner for noncompliance committed by tenant.

342.title: Sexual Offense Victim or Witness Testimony
342.description: Authorizes trial court to order videotaping of testimony of victim of sexual battery; expands who may stipulate that requirement for presence of judge at videotaping of testimony may be waived; authorizes trial court to order use of closed circuit television in proceedings involving victim of sexual battery; permits certain persons to be present in room during recording of testimony; redefines term "sexual offense victim or witness."

343.title: Special Review Commission/Lethal Use-of-force Incidents
343.description: Creates Special Review Commission; provides for commission membership; specifies membership requirements; requires law enforcement agencies to report lethal use-of-force incidents to commission; requires state attorneys & other prosecuting entities to notify commission of inquiries into use-of-force fatalities & determinations not to pursue charges; requires commission to review lethal use-of-force incidents; authorizes commission to refer incidents to AG for prosecution consideration; authorizes commission to subpoena documents & witnesses; authorizes AG to bring criminal charges; prohibits commission actions that could constitute double jeopardy.

344.title: Bail Bonds
344.description: Revises legislative intent concerning obligations of bail bond agent; specifies that failure to appear requires bond & bonds or money deposited as bail to be forfeited; revises circumstances that require forfeiture to be discharged; revises amount of forfeiture to be remitted under different specified conditions; specifies that certain provisions concerning cancellation of bond do not apply if bond is forfeited within specified period after it has been posted; provides that original appearance bond does not guarantee placement in any court-ordered program.

345.title: Specialty License Plates/Vision For Excellence
345.description: Directs DHSMV to develop Vision For Excellence license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plates.

346.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
346.title: Local Governments
346.description: Authorizes use of impact fees to construct new capital facilities & to improve, alter, or expand existing capital facilities; authorizes county, municipality, or school district to impose surcharge on certain real property transactions in lieu of imposing impact fees; restricts amount of surcharge; specifies procedures enacting ordinance to authorize surcharge; requires county, municipality, or school district to deposit revenues into special trust fund; specifies authorized uses of surcharge revenues; prohibits county, municipality, or school district that imposes surcharge from imposing impact fee for same purpose.

347.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
347.title: Unemployment Compensation
347.description: Clarifies application of provision relating to disqualification for benefits; provides that certain victims of domestic violence may not be disqualified for benefits for voluntarily leaving work.

348.title: Secondhand Dealers
348.description: Requiring that the record of a secondhand dealer transaction include digital photographs of the items; requiring secondhand dealers to notify a law enforcement official under certain circumstances; revising the required holding period for certain goods acquired by a dealer; authorizing an action in replevin against a secondhand dealer based on a right of possession to stolen goods; revising the period of time a secondhand dealer must hold secondhand goods at a registered location, etc.

349.title: Public Records/Substance Abuse Treatment Involuntary Admissions Court Proceedings
349.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain records of court proceedings relating to involuntary admissions for substance abuse treatment services; permits clerk of court to allow certain persons access to such records; provides applicability; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

350.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 826 (Ch. 2016-169)
350.title: Mobile Homes
350.description: Revises certain notice requirements for written complaints; requires adoption of rules relating to board member training for mobile home park homeowners' associations; authorizes mobile home park owner to pass on non-ad valorem assessments to tenant; provides that mobile home park owner is deemed to have disclosed passing on of certain taxes & assessments; requires non-ad valorem assessments to be part of lot rental amount; requires that renewed rental agreement remain under same terms unless certain notice is provided; authorizes mobile home purchaser to cancel or rescind contract to purchase; revises rights that mobile home owners exercise if they form an association; authorizes mobile home owners to become members upon incorporation of association; deletes provisions relating to memberships of successors to home owners; clarifying when association becomes representative of all mobile home owners; specifies voting requirements for homeowners' associations; authorizes members to vote by secret ballot & absentee ballot; prohibits tape recording or videotaping of certain meetings; delays applicability of certain board member training requirements; specifies future date after which directors who fail to comply with training requirements are deemed to commit violation.

352.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 494 (Ch. 2016-46)
352.title: Digital Assets
352.description: Designates act as "Florida Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act; authorizes user to use online tool to allow custodian to disclose digital assets to designated recipient or to prohibit custodian from disclosing digital assets; provides that specified user's direction overrides in terms-of-service agreement; authorizes modification of fiduciary's or designated recipient's access to digital assets; provides procedures for disclosure of digital assets; requires custodian to disclose content of electronic communications & other digital assets of deceased user; requires custodian to disclose content of electronic communications & other digital assets of principal; requires custodian to disclose to trustee who is original user digital assets & content of electronic communications held in trust; authorizes court to grant guardian right to access ward's digital assets; requires custodian to disclose to guardian electronic communications & specified digital assets of ward; imposes fiduciary duties; provides for rights & responsibilities of certain fiduciaries; requires compliance of custodian; provides for immunity for certain persons acting in good faith.

353.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-88, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7007 (Ch. 2016-61)
353.title: Agriculture
353.description: Revising the period during which certain agricultural lands in eradication or quarantine programs continue to be classified as such; exempting certain farm vehicles from registration requirements under certain circumstances; preempting regulatory authority over commercial feed and feedstuff to the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services; providing for conservation easement agreements to include provisions which allow agricultural activities under certain conditions, etc.

354.title: Transparency in State Education Funding
