354.description: Specifies information required to be in school district tentative budget advertisement; requires DOE to annually provide certain information relating to required local effort tax revenue for all school districts, GAA to include certain increase or decrease in certain required local effort tax revenue, & Legislature to include increase or decrease in required local effort in certain calculation.

355.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
355.title: Economic Incentives for Small Technology Companies
355.description: Provides that small technology company is eligible for loan guarantee under the Microfinance Guarantee Program; provides appropriation.

356.title: Corrections
356.description: Revises method of appointment for Secretary of Corrections; creates Florida Corrections Commission; revises definition of "victim injury" by removing prohibition on assessing certain victim injury sentence points for sexual misconduct by an employee of DOC or private correctional facility; expands DOC's security review committee functions; revises provisions relating to use of force; revises reporting requirements; requires DOC to measure recidivism; revises provisions relating to trust funds; prohibits purchase of weight-training equipment; requires DOC to consider needs of inmates over 50 years of age; allows inmate & others to hire & pay for an independent medical evaluation; specifies purpose for outside evaluations; expands eligibility for conditional medical release.

357.title: Trust Funds/Creation/State-Operated Institutions Inmate Welfare Trust Fund/DOC
357.description: Creates State-Operated Institutions Inmate Welfare Trust Fund within DOC; provides purpose; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

358.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 912 (Ch. 2016-173)
358.title: Fraudulent Activities Associated with Payment Systems
358.description: Revises felony classification for unlawful conveyance of fuel; requires retail petroleum fuel measuring devices fitted with scanning devices to have certain security measures; revises prohibition against trafficking in or possessing counterfeit credit cards or related documents; revises penalties; revises ranking of unlawful conveyance or fraudulent acquisition of fuel, & ranks trafficking in or possessing counterfeit credit cards or related documents, on offense severity ranking chart.

359.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
359.title: Involuntary Commitment under the Baker Act
359.description: Requires evidence of Alzheimer's disease or dementia-related disorder to be indicated in court order for involuntary examination; provides for temporary placement in secure area within receiving facility designated for persons with Alzheimer's disease or dementia-related disorder; limits timeframe for examination of persons with Alzheimer's disease or dementia-related disorder.

360.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
360.title: Cottage Food Operations
360.description: Deletes annual gross sales limitation for exempting cottage food operations from certain food & building permitting requirements.

361.title: Mental Health Treatment
361.description: Provides for continuation of psychotropic medication by forensic & civil facilities for individuals receiving such medication before admission; provides timeframes within which competency & commitment hearings must be held; revises time for dismissal of certain charges for defendants who remain incompetent to proceed to trial; provides exceptions; provides timeframe within which commitment hearings must be held; requires that defendant be transported for such hearing.

362.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
362.title: Drug-Free Workplaces
362.description: Revises contents of employer policy statement with respect to employee drug use; revises frequency of followup testing; revises specimen collection, verification, & documentation procedures; revises requirements for confirmation testing.

363.title: Special Assessments on Agricultural Lands
363.description: Prohibits counties & municipalities from levying special assessments on certain agricultural lands for fire protection services; provides specified exceptions.

364.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1288 (Ch. 2016-198)
364.title: Emergency Preparedness and Response
364.description: Directs DEM to create statewide system to facilitate transport & distribution of essentials in commerce during declared emergency; defines "essentials"; directs DEM to create certification system for certain persons & employers; authorizes certain activities by certified persons during curfew; authorizes law enforcement officer to specify permissible route of ingress or egress for certified person.

365.title: Criminal Justice Standards and Training Commission
365.description: Requires Criminal Justice Standards & Training Commission to develop & administer examination of basic abilities for all officer candidates entering basic recruit training for law enforcement & corrections; authorizes rulemaking; provides for standards; provides for fee for examination & disposition of funds.

366.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 535 (Ch. 2016-129)
366.title: Alarm System Registration
366.description: Provides uniform process for registration of home & business alarm systems; requires owner, lessee, or occupant, or authorized representative thereof, of property to register alarm system within 20 days after occupancy or after installation of alarm system; authorizes applicable local governmental entity to charge registration fee; specifies requirements of application form; requires owner, lessee, or occupant, or authorized representative thereof, to notify applicable local governmental agency of change in information provided in application form within 30 days; authorizes applicable local governmental entity to assess or impose fines or penalties for failure to register alarm system or for excessive false alarms; provides that fines & penalties are responsibility of owner, lessee, or occupant of property.

367.title: Injunctions for Protection against Domestic Violence
367.description: Establishes Protective Injunction Electronic Filing Pilot Program within Office of State Courts Administrator; provides for selection of pilot program counties; specifies objectives; provides for petitioners to file petitions for injunction electronically & testify at final injunction hearings by video teleconference from remote locations in pilot program counties; provides duties of clerks of courts in pilot program counties, including submission of annual report to Legislature; requires report by OPPAGA by certain date.

368.title: Unclaimed Property
368.description: Provides exception to unclaimed property reporting requirements; requires certain unclaimed funds to be deposited with CFO; revises aggregate value that constitutes small estate account; revises requirements for power of attorney used in recovery of unclaimed property; eliminates maximum fee provision for recovery; revises requirements for contracts to acquire ownership of or entitlement to unclaimed property; repeals provisions relating to void unclaimed property powers of attorney & purchase agreements.

369.title: St. Lucie County Fire District, St. Lucie County
369.description: Revises requirements for Board of Commissioners of St. Lucie County Fire District to borrow money.

370.last_action: Died in Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations Subcommittee
370.title: Suspended Driver Licenses
370.description: Establishes Driver License Reinstatement Days pilot program in certain counties to facilitate reinstatement of suspended driver licenses.

371.title: Local Government Finance
371.description: Authorizes municipality to levy special assessment to fund law enforcement services under certain circumstances; provides methodology to apportion special assessment & reduce ad valorem millage; requires property appraiser to list special assessment on TRIM notices; provides for termination of municipality's special assessment; requires certain municipalities to issue procurement requests for delinquent revenues; provides that municipalities issuing procurement requests are not required to enter into contract; excludes certain delinquent revenues from threshold calculations; requires bid copies to be filed with DFS; requires that discussion of capital recovery efforts be included in management letter accompanying municipality's annual financial audit report.

372.title: Local Tax Referenda
372.description: Prohibits local government discretionary sales surtax referenda from being held during special elections; specifies varying percentage of electors voting in referendum which is required, depending on type of election at which referendum is held, to adopt or amend local government discretionary sales surtax.

373.title: Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program
373.description: Provides that initial award period & renewal period for students who are unable to accept initial award immediately after high school due to specific obligations begins upon completion of obligation; requires student, as prerequisite for certain awards, to identify social or civic issue or professional area of interest & develop specified plan; creates Florida Gold Seal CAPE Scholars award; provides appropriation.

374.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1176 (Ch. 2016-195)
374.title: Dredge and Fill Activities
374.description: Revises acreage of wetlands & surface waters subject to impact by dredge & fill activities under state programmatic general permits; provides that seeking to use such permits consents to specified federal wetland jurisdiction criteria; authorizes DEP to delegate federal permitting programs for the discharge of dredged or fill material under certain conditions; deletes certain conditions limiting when DEP may assume federal permitting programs for discharge of dredged or fill material.

375.title: Sentencing
375.description: Permits persons convicted of specified trafficking violation to receive sentence that departs from mandatory minimum in certain circumstances; specifies who may move for such departure; specifies criteria that may be considered; requires court to state reasons for granting such motion.

376.title: Out-of-State Fee Waivers for Active Duty Servicemembers
376.description: Provides that active duty members of Armed Forces of U.S. residing or stationed outside of this state may receive out-of-state fee waivers; requires tuition & fees charged to such students to be below specified amount & for annual report of all out-of-state fee waivers for such individuals.

377.title: Specialty License Plates
377.description: Revises distribution & use requirements for annual use fees for Share Road & In God We Trust specialty license plates; directs DHSMV to develop Support Special Needs Kids, America the Beautiful, Ducks Unlimited, Bonefish & Tarpon Trust, Educate Engage Empower, Dogs Making a Difference, National Wild Turkey Federation, Rotary, Florida Bay Forever, & Alzheimer's Community Care specialty license plates; provides for distribution of annual use fees received from sale of such plates.

378.last_action: Died in Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations Subcommittee
378.title: Historic and Archaeological Artifacts
378.description: Directs Division of Historical Resources of DOS to implement program to administer discovery of certain historic & archaeological artifacts; provides program requirements; directs division to adopt rules.

379.title: Motor Fuels
379.description: Prohibits producer, refiner, or subsidiary from operating certain retail outlets selling its petroleum products.

380.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
380.title: Florida Microfinance Act
380.description: Revises Microfinance Loan Program & Microfinance Guarantee Program; revises legislative intent & conforms terminology; provides that EFI rather than DEO is responsible for entering into funding agreements with loan administrators; revises loan administrator qualifications & contracting requirements; authorizes microloan interest charges & fees; revises loan administrator fees; revises microloan eligibility; revises requirements for administrative contract between DEO & EFI; revises eligibility & terms for loan guarantees; authorizes surety bond guarantees; revises annual reporting requirements; revises timeline for report by EDR.

381.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
381.title: Tuition and Fee Exemptions
381.description: Requires SBE & BOG to adopt certain rules & regulations relating to tuition & fee exemptions for specified students.

382.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
382.title: Homestead Property Tax Discount for Surviving Spouses
382.description: Provides for transfer of certain discount on ad valorem taxes on homestead property to surviving spouse of specified disabled veteran under certain circumstances; provides for transfer of discount by surviving spouse to new homestead property under certain circumstances.

383.title: Courts
383.description: Revises provisions concerning books, records, & other materials of Supreme Court & DCAs; revises provisions concerning filing of decisions of Supreme Court & DCAs & their judges; transfers headquarters of 2d Appellate District; removes requirement that clerk of DCA keep records at headquarters office; requires such clerk to have office at headquarters.

384.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 286 (Ch. 2016-111)
384.title: Merger and Acquisition Brokers
384.description: Exempts specified offer or sale of securities from requirements to register with OFR & provides requirements for such transactions; exempts merger & acquisition broker from certain registration requirements under certain circumstances.

385.title: Sunset Review of Medicaid Dental Services
385.description: Providing for the future removal of dental services as a minimum benefit of managed care plans; requiring the Office of Program Policy Analysis and Government Accountability to provide a report to the Governor and Legislature; requiring the Agency for Health Care Administration to implement a statewide Medicaid prepaid dental health program upon the occurrence of certain conditions; specifying requirements for the program and the selection of providers, etc.

386.title: Reimbursement of Assessments
386.description: Prohibits agent or attorney representing claimant from directly or indirectly requesting, receiving, or obtaining reimbursement from claimant for assessments charged to agent or attorney by U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs; provides penalties.

387.title: Substance Abuse and Recovery Fraudulent Business Practices Pilot Project
387.description: Provides legislative findings; establishes Substance Abuse & Recovery Fraudulent Business Practices Pilot Project within Office of State Attorney for Fifteenth Judicial Circuit; provides for appointment & terms of members & establishes duties of an advisory panel; authorizes state attorney to terminate project; requires report to Governor & Legislature.

388.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1110 (Ch. 2016-193)
388.title: Central Florida Expressway Authority
388.description: Revises provisions for membership & organization of governing body of authority; specifies date that terms of certain members end; removes provision that requires title to former Orlando-Orange County Expressway System be transferred to state.

389.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
389.title: Funding for High School Interscholastic Athletic Programs
389.description: Levies surcharge on admission charges for professional sporting events; defines "professional sporting event"; provides that certain admissions are exempt from surcharge; requires DOR to administer, collect, & enforce surcharge; provides for deposit & use of surcharge proceeds for high school interscholastic athletic programs; provides formula for allocating funds among school districts & high schools.

390.title: District School Board Home Rule Powers
390.description: Designates provisions as "District School Board Educational Innovation & Home Rule Powers Act"; authorizes school district to establish itself as home rule school district by rule; provides requirements for home rule school districts & exemptions from certain laws & rules; authorizes home rule school district to use certain funds as school district deems necessary; provides for reporting, rulemaking, & severability.

391.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 695 (Ch. 2016-57)
391.title: Title Insurance Reserve
391.description: Revises reserves that certain title insurers must set aside after certain date; revises provisions relating to reserves for title insurer who transfers domicile to this state.

392.title: Public School Recess
392.description: Requires district school board to provide students in certain grades with certain amount of free-play recess per day; provides that free-play recess may not be withheld for specified reasons.

393.last_action: Died in Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 837 (Ch. 2016-137)
393.title: Education
393.description: Revises provisions relating to home education programs, nonenrollment & nonattendance cases, dual enrollment programs, & Florida Gold Seal Vocational Scholars award.

394.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-137, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62), CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
394.title: Education Programs for Individuals with Disabilities
394.description: Exempting a foster child from specified eligibility provisions; providing that a student enrolled in a transition-to-work program is eligible for a John M. McKay Scholarship; creating a transition-to-work program for specific students enrolled in the John M. McKay Scholarships for Students with Disabilities Program; exempting a John M. McKay Scholarship award from a specified funding calculation, etc.

395.title: Auditor General
395.description: Requires Auditor General to annually conduct performance audit of randomly selected state agency.

396.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
396.title: Nonresidential Farm Buildings
396.description: Exempts nonresidential farm buildings, farm fences, & farm signs located on lands used for bona fide agricultural purposes from any county or municipal special assessment or dependent special district assessment; provides exception.

397.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
397.title: Designation of State Bird
397.description: Designates Florida scrub-jay as official state bird; specifies that act supersedes designation of mockingbird as state bird.

398.title: Bay County Bridge Authority, Bay County
398.description: Abolishes Bay County Bridge Authority; transfers authority's assets & liabilities to Bay County.

399.title: Pasco County
399.description: Repeals certain provisions relating to sewage treatment facility discharges into coastal waters within Pasco County or waters tributary thereto.

401.title: Onsite Sewage Treatment and Disposal Systems
401.description: Deletes prohibition of land application of septage from onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems & abrogates scheduled reversion of amendments to s. 381.0065(6), F.S.

402.title: Law Enforcement Officer Training
402.description: Expands instruction that Criminal Justice Standards & Training Commission requires of law enforcement officer to include interpersonal skills relating to racial minorities.

403.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee
403.title: Railroad Walkways
403.description: Requires railroad companies to provide walkways adjacent to certain sections of tracks.

404.title: Public Records/Attorney Fees
404.description: Authorizes court to hold custodian of public record personally liable in civil action under certain conditions.

405.title: Education in Public Schools Concerning Human Sexuality
405.description: Creates "Florida Healthy Adolescent Act"; requires public schools that provide information or programs relating to human sexuality to provide comprehensive, medically accurate, & factual information that is developmentally & age appropriate; provides for review of certain materials & students to be excused in certain circumstances; repeals certain health education provisions.

406.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
406.title: Internship Tax Credit Program
406.description: Authorizes corporate income tax credit of up to specified amount for degree-seeking student hired by certain businesses after internship by student; provides eligibility criteria; authorizes DOR to adopt rules governing applications & establish qualification requirements; authorizes business to carry forward tax credit for specified period.

407.title: Boating Safety
407.description: Provides requirements for operation of recreational vessels by persons younger than specified age; revises minimum age to operate personal watercraft; removes exemption from photographic identification & boating safety identification card requirement for person accompanied in vessel by another person who meets certain criteria.

408.title: Abortion
408.description: Creates "Florida for Life Act"; prohibits induced abortions; prohibits operation of facility for purpose of providing abortion services; prohibits termination of pregnancy unless specified conditions are met; requires informed consent; deletes exemption from requirement to view ultrasound for victims of rape, incest, domestic violence, or human trafficking; provides standard of care if fetus is viable; requires that fetal remains be disposed of according to specified standards; provides restrictions on use of state & federal funds for state exchanges that provide coverage for induced abortions & termination of pregnancies under certain conditions.

409.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 447 (Ch. 2016-225)
409.title: Land Authorities
409.description: Authorizes land authorities to acquire real & personal property or interest therein to reduce impacts on hurricane evacuation clearance times & to contribute funds to DEP for acquisition of lands by DEP.

410.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1004 (Ch. 2016-178)
410.title: Public Records/Security Systems Plans and Information
410.description: Revises exceptions to public records exemption for security system plans; provides exceptions to public records exemption for information relating to certain security systems.

411.title: Broward County
411.description: Repeals penalty for exceeding speed limit in specified waterways; repeals requirements for erection of waterway speed limit signs.

413.title: Motor Vehicle Service Agreement Companies
413.description: Revises & provides definitions relating to motor vehicle service agreement companies.

414.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
414.title: Beach Management and Erosion Control
414.description: Revises criteria to be considered by DEP in determining & assigning annual funding priorities for beach management & erosion control projects; requires such criteria to be considered in specified order.

415.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 908 (Ch. 2016-165), CS/CS/CS/HB 651 (Ch. 2016-132)
415.title: Organization of the Department of Financial Services
415.description: Authorizes CFO, rather than Division of Accounting & Auditing, to audit & adjust accounts of officers & those indebted to state; revises divisions & location of bureaus within & divisions; amends provisions relating to transfer of certain functions to Division of Investigative & Forensic Services; amends provisions relating to renaming of the Bureau of Unclaimed Property.

417.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1044 (Ch. 2016-179)
417.title: Forfeiture of Contraband
417.description: Provides for acquisition of provisional title of seized property; prohibits forfeiture under Florida Contraband Forfeiture Act from being final until owner of seized property is convicted of criminal act that renders property contraband article; provides that property is deemed contraband article & forfeited subject to forfeiture proceedings; specifies circumstances under which seizing law enforcement agency must return property; removes provision vesting rights, interests, & title to contraband articles in seizing law enforcement agency.

418.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1174 (Ch. 2016-74)
418.title: Residential Facilities
418.description: Specifies applicability of siting requirements for community residential homes; provides applicability with respect to local land use & zoning.

419.title: Computer Coding Instruction
419.description: Requires Higher Education Coordinating Council to make recommendations related to computer science instruction & provide report; requires Commissioner of Education to develop certain standards & identify certain courses in Course Code Directory; requires students have access to computer science courses through various means; requires DOE to report certain information to certain entities; requires certain entities to develop strategies relating to computer science educator certification & teacher recruitment; provides appropriation & authorizes a position.

420.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1044 (Ch. 2016-179)
420.title: Contraband Forfeiture
420.description: Specifies circumstances under which property may be seized; requires that specified persons approve settlement; provides circumstances when property may be deemed contraband; allocates responsibility for damage to seized property & payment of storage & maintenance expenses; provides procedure for judicial review of seizures; requires seizing agency to pay filing fee to & deposit bond with clerk of court by; specifies circumstances when court shall order forfeiture of seized property; provides reporting requirements for seized property for forfeiture; provides penalties for noncompliance with reporting requirements.

421.title: Northwest Florida Community Hospital Board of Trustees, Washington County
421.description: Abolishes Northwest Florida Community Hospital Board of Trustees; transfers board's assets & liabilities to Washington County.

422.title: Daylight Saving Time
422.description: Requires that State of Florida & its political subdivisions observe daylight saving time year-round.

423.title: West Manatee Fire and Rescue District, Manatee County
423.description: Revises provisions for terms of members of district's board of commissioners; deletes obsolete provisions relating to initial commissioners; provides for continuation of staggered terms; confirming certain non-ad valorem assessment rates adopted by district on specified date; specifies that district may amend assessment rates authorized by district's enabling legislation.

424.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1104 (Ch. 2016-180)
424.title: Service of Process on Financial Institutions
424.description: Requires service on financial institutions to be made in accordance with s. 655.0201, F.S.; revises applicability of provisions of law governing service of process on financial institutions; authorizes certain financial institutions to designate with DOS place or registered agent located within state as such institution's sole location or agent for service of process, notice, levy, or demand; provides that service of process, notice, levy, or demand may be made during specified time periods; provides exceptions if financial institution does not have registered agent, if service cannot be made at sole location, or for service made by Office of Financial Regulation.

425.title: Instructional Materials for K-12 Public Education
425.description: Requires instructional materials to meet certain standards & each district school board to adopt process allowing taxpayer to object to use of specific instructional materials based on specified criteria; revises requirement that district school superintendent certify that all instructional materials for core courses meet certain standards.

426.title: Public Records/Property Tax Exemption for Totally and Permanently Disabled Persons
426.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for medical & personal identifying information of applicant for or recipient of property tax exemption for totally & permanently disabled persons; authorizes disclosure under certain circumstances; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

427.title: Public School Educational Assessments and Accountability
427.description: Suspends use of FSA results for certain purposes for specific school years; provides for determination of promotion or retention of grade 3 student; requires grade 10 student to earn concordant score to meet specific graduation requirement; suspends school grades for specific school years; requires SBE to adopt & implement new school grading system.

428.title: Arrest Booking Photographs
428.description: Prohibits persons who publish or disseminate arrest booking photographs through certain media from soliciting or accepting payment of fee or other consideration to remove, correct, or modify such photograph; provides civil remedies & civil penalty; provides exceptions; prohibits criminal justice agency from electronically publishing arrest booking photographs of certain arrestees; provides exceptions; provides construction.

429.last_action: Died in Education Appropriations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
429.title: Youth Suicide Awareness and Prevention
429.description: Requires DOE to incorporate training in youth suicide awareness & prevention into certain instructional personnel continuing education or inservice training requirements & to develop list of approved materials for training; provides that no cause of action results from implementation of act.

430.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
430.title: Special Assessments
430.description: Requires county or municipality to reduce its ad valorem tax levy by estimated amount of revenue to be generated from certain special assessments levied after specified date; prohibits such special assessment from exceeding corresponding reduction in county's or municipality's ad valorem tax levy.

431.title: City of Delray Beach, Palm Beach County
431.description: Repeals City of Delray Beach's civil service act; requires referendum.

432.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
432.title: Private Security Services
432.description: Requires applicants for licensure as armed security officers to complete substance abuse & mental illness coursework & provide statement from mental health professional.

433.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
433.title: Continuity of Care for Medically Stable Patients
433.description: Prohibits insurance policies, HMO contracts, & pharmacy benefit managers from limiting or excluding coverage for, increasing payments for, or adjusting tiered formulary with respect to certain drugs approved for coverage of specified medical conditions; authorizes generic substitutions; applies prohibition to group health insurance, blanket health insurance, & franchise health insurance.

434.last_action: Died in Government Operations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7012 (Ch. 2016-213)
434.title: Death Benefits Under Florida Retirement System
434.description: Authorizes payment of death benefits to surviving spouse or surviving children of Special Risk Class member in investment plan; establishes qualifications & eligibility requirements in order to receive such benefits; prescribes method of calculating benefit; specifies circumstances under which benefit payments are terminated; provides legislative intent; requires SBA or Division of Retirement to take certain action upon receipt of notification of disqualification from IRS; authorizes state board & DMS to adopt rules; provides for allocations for death benefits authorized by act; adjusts employer contribution rates in order to fund changes made by act; provides directive to DOLRI; declares that act fulfills important state interest.

435.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1083 (Ch. 2016-140)
435.title: Involuntary Admission to Residential Services
435.description: Requires APD to employ or contract with qualified evaluator to conduct review of status of persons involuntarily admitted to residential services provided by APD; requires review of such placements by court at hearing; requires APD to provide copy of review & notice of hearing to specified persons; provides appropriation.

436.title: Overseas Absentee Ballots
436.description: Requires DOS to develop instructions & procedures allowing electronic submission of voted absentee ballots from overseas voters; requires DOS & supervisors of elections to develop security measures; prescribes requirements for such security measures; requires DOS to perform annual security assessment.

437.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
437.title: For the Greater Good Attorney Student Loan Repayment Program
437.description: Creates student loan repayment program for attorneys employed by local, state, or federal government agencies; limits eligibility to attorneys employed for less than specified period & earning less than specified salary; provides for administration & funding of program; provides award amounts for attorneys based on specified eligibility criteria; provides loan payment requirements; provides for rulemaking.

438.title: Relinquishment of Weapons by Persons Subject to Protective Injunctions
438.description: Requires persons subject to domestic violence, stalking, & cyberstalking injunctions to relinquish firearms; provides for relinquishment to law enforcement officers or licensed firearms dealers; provides exception; provides for proof of transfer; provides requirements for forms.

439.title: Pub. Rec./Records Concerning Firearms Relinquished Pursuant to Protective Injunctions
439.description: Exempts records containing identifying data of either respondent, petitioner, or recipient of firearms relinquished pursuant provisions relating to injunctions against domestic violence, stalking, or cyberstalking; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity.

440.title: Peril of Flood
440.description: Authorizes insurers to issue flood insurance policies on flexible basis; extends date by which insurers may use certain statutory rate standards for establishing & using flood coverage rates; authorizes surplus lines agents to export contracts or endorsements providing flood coverage to eligible surplus lines insurers without satisfying specified conditions & extends date by which such agent may export such contracts or endorsements.

442.title: Investigation of Lethal Force by Law Enforcement Officers
442.description: Requires head of law enforcement agency to report to FDLE within specified timeframe if use of force by officer results in death of another person; requires agency head to provide results of agency's investigation to FDLE within specified timeframe; requires FDLE to conduct independent investigation.

443.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
443.title: Concealed Weapon or Firearm Licensees
443.description: Requires concealed weapon or firearm licensee to provide certain information & display such license & proper identification when approached by first responder; increasing the fine amount for violation of such requirement; specifies requirements for firearm safety and training courses; requires firearm course instructors to maintain certain records; requires that such license be suspended or revoked upon second or subsequent violation of such requirement.

444.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
444.title: Tierra Verde Fire Control and Rescue District, Pinellas County
444.description: Creates district; provides charter; requires referendum.

445.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
445.title: Aerial Photographs and Nonproperty Ownership Maps
445.description: Revises county population thresholds for purposes of identifying the governmental entity responsible for payment of aerial photographs & maps.

446.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-230, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5103 (Ch. 2016-25)
446.title: Department of Health
446.description: Creating & revising reporting requirements for specified research programs; providing licensing requirements for military members & their spouses; revising provisions relating to regulatory activities of DOH & certain boards; revising education requirements for certain health professions to qualify for license renewal.

447.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7053 (Ch. 2016-238)
447.title: Prenatal Services and Early Childhood Development
447.description: Revises requirements for DOH to maintain clearinghouse of information for parents & health care providers on developmental evaluation & early intervention programs; renames "Infants and Toddlers Early Intervention Program" as "Early Steps Program"; requires development of individual family support plan for each child served in program.

448.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
448.title: Downtown Development Authority of the City of Fort Lauderdale, Broward County
448.description: Amends boundaries; revises budget & millage procedures; requires referendum.

449.title: Long-Acting Reversible Contraception Pilot Program
449.description: Requires DOH to contract with family planning providers throughout state to provide long-acting reversible contraception devices & related services; requires DOH to apply for grants for additional funding; provides appropriations.

450.title: Attorneys for Dependent Children
450.description: Revises requirements for dependent child to be appointed an attorney; requires that court appoint substitute counsel if attorney withdraws or is discharged by court; provides that all appointed attorneys & organizations are entitled to funding for litigation costs; requires appointed attorneys to report certain information; requires JAC to contract with nonprofit entity to establish Quality Counsel Program; requires quality improvement program; requires annual report; requires Quality Counsel Program to be established & fully operational by specified date.

451.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1170 (Ch. 2016-194)
451.title: Health Plan Regulatory Administration
451.description: Authorizes local governmental units to contract with certain corporations to provide group insurance for officers & employees; deletes provisions relating to exclusion of individuals with preexisting conditions from insurance coverage; revises exemptions from requirements of certain health insurance policies; redefines creditable coverage.

452.title: Legislative Reauthorization of Agency Rulemaking Authority
452.description: Provides for suspension of certain rulemaking authority after specified period until reauthorized by general law; provides for expiration of such reauthorization after specified period; provides for suspension of rulemaking authority upon expiration of reauthorization until reauthorized by general law; requires legislative ratification of rules adopted while rulemaking authority is suspended; authorizes Governor to delay suspension for specified period; authorizes legislative presiding officers to appoint joint committee; requires committee to submit annual report; authorizes agency to provide notice of rulemaking authority subject to suspension; specifies that lawfully adopted rules remain in effect during suspension; revises limitations with respect to timeframe in which emergency rule may be effective.

454.title: Physician Orders for Life-Sustaining Treatment
454.description: Requires DOH to develop & adopt by rule physician orders for life-sustaining treatment (POLST) form; requires AHCA to act as state clearinghouse for compassionate & palliative care plans; authorizes hospice care team to withhold or withdraw cardiopulmonary resuscitation if patient has POLST form that contains such order; requires DOH to establish procedures for honoring POLST form; requires health care surrogate to provide written consent for POLST form under certain circumstances.

455.title: Transportation
455.description: Requires toll agencies to adopt policy regarding removal of directors; requires toll agencies to post meeting recordings on Internet within specified time & in format suitable for user's browser; requires toll agencies to provide an accounting of disbursements of penalty amounts; directs FTC to conduct study of potential for express toll lanes to display estimated travel times; directs DOT to pay expenses of study; provides requirements for certain toll collection systems.

456.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
456.title: Health Insurance Restrictions on Prescription Medication Protocols
456.description: Requires Medicaid managed care plan, insurer, or HMO to allow prescribing provider to request override of restriction on use of medication imposed through step-therapy or fail-first protocol; prohibits duration of step-therapy or fail-first protocol from exceeding time period specified by prescribing provider.

457.title: Firesafety
457.description: Revises firesafety standards for assisted living facilities & provides exemption for certain assisted living facilities under certain conditions.

459.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1412 (Ch. 2016-204)
459.title: Orders of No Contact
459.description: Revises requirements for notifying defendant of no contact order if issued by court as condition of pretrial release.

460.title: Community Development Districts
460.description: Amends acreage threshold for establishment of community development district; authorizes district to contract with towing operator to remove vehicles or vessels from specified properties; authorizes up to certain number of districts to merge; provides for membership of surviving merged district; provides requirements of merger agreement; provides for public hearings; prohibits petition to merge from being filed within specified timeframe.

461.title: Student Hardship Evaluation Program
461.description: Creates hardship evaluation program for students with financial hardships who are preparing for licensure as health care practitioners or veterinarians & who are referred to an impaired practitioner program; provides conditions for participation; provides for submission of invoices to DOH by consultants & for payment of evaluators directly by department; requires submission of monthly progress reports to department; requires that identity of participating students be protected in billing for services & progress reports; provides for funding from Medical Quality Assurance Trust Fund.

462.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
462.title: West Villages Improvement District, Sarasota County

463.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-231, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 423 (Ch. 2016-224)
463.title: Behavioral Health Workforce
463.description: Authorizing a second opinion for admission to a treatment facility to be provided by certain licensed physicians in all counties, rather than counties with a specified population size; restricting to physicians the authorization to dispense certain medications or prescribe certain controlled substances on the premises of a registered pain-management clinic; providing certification criteria for psychiatric nurses; providing that certain acts by a psychiatric nurse constitute grounds for denial of a license or disciplinary action, etc.

464.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 12 (Ch. 2016-241)
464.title: Behavioral Health Care Services
464.description: Revises Florida Mental Health Act; revises duration of involuntary outpatient & involuntary inpatient commitment orders; revises legislative intent with respect to mental health & substance abuse treatment services; revises criteria for involuntary admission for assessment, stabilization, & treatment for substance abuse impairment; specifies professionals authorized to execute certificate for emergency admission; prohibits court from charging fee for filing of petition for involuntary assessment, stabilization, or treatment; provides time limitation on court order authorizing involuntary assessment & stabilization; revises responsibilities of service providers who admit an individual for involuntary assessment & stabilization.

466.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
466.title: State Park System Sales Tax Exemption
466.description: Exempts state park entrance fees & annual entrance passes from sales & use tax.

467.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 922 (Ch. 2016-174), CS/CS/CS/HB 589 (Ch. 2016-130)
467.title: Solid Waste Management
467.description: Authorizes specified percentage of funds from Solid Waste Management Trust Fund to be used for funding waste tire abatement program; establishes solid waste landfill closure account within Solid Waste Management Trust Fund; authorizes DEP to use account funds to contract with third party for closure & long-term care of solid waste management facilities under specified circumstances; provides for deposit of certain insurance policy funds; authorizes DEP to use funds to pay for or reimburse specified expenses; revises eligibility criteria for small-county consolidated grant program; authorizes waste tire abatement programs under such program; eliminates waste tire abatement program supported by solid waste management grant program; removes distribution requirements.

468.title: Implementation of the Water and Land Conservation Constitutional Amendment
468.description: Requiring specified amounts of funds within the Land Acquisition Trust Fund to be appropriated for certain projects; providing a preference in the use of funds distributed for Everglades restoration projects for projects that reduce harmful discharges to the St. Lucie estuary and the Caloosahatchee estuary; requiring such appropriations to be reduced by an amount equal to the debt service paid on bonds issued for specified purposes, etc.

469.last_action: Died in K-12 Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
469.title: Auditory-oral Education Programs
469.description: Requires school district to annually add specified number of points to total score of all domains on matrix of services for certain children; specifies that such children are eligible for auditory-oral education grants under certain circumstances.

470.title: Legislative and Congressional Redistricting
470.description: Creates independent commission on legislative & congressional redistricting; provides for purpose, membership, & duties of commission; exempts commission from rulemaking requirements; provides for contingent effect.

471.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
471.title: Local Government Infrastructure Surtax
471.description: Authorizes county to levy discretionary sales surtax to fund certain capital projects to restore natural water bodies for public use under certain circumstnaces; authorizes proceeds & interest from surtax to be used for certain dredging operations.

472.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
472.title: Motor Vehicle Insurance
472.description: Provides that payment for treatment of injured person is deemed reasonable if it complies with specified schedule; specifies that certain attorney fee provisions apply to disputes involving noncorporate assignee; prohibits recovery of attorney fees by health care provider under certain circumstances; provides that certain provisions do not prohibit insurer of private passenger motor vehicle from excluding coverage for certain household members in certain circumstances; repeals Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law on future date.

473.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
473.title: Persons with Disabilities
473.description: Requires law enforcement agencies to report certain criminal activity & enforcement of certain laws to FDLE & DHSMV; requires DHSMV to consider course content relating to traffic laws to assist legally blind & mobility-impaired persons; requires examination questions & traffic law education programs, basic skills course for law enforcement officers, & driver education programs to include material relating to laws to assist legally blind & mobility-impaired persons.

474.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
474.title: Employment After Retirement of School District Personnel
474.description: Revises provisions relating to reemployment of retirees as instructional personnel on contractual basis.

475.title: Prejudgment Interest
475.description: Provides for award of prejudgment interest in any action in which plaintiff recovers monetary damages; provides for calculation of interest; provides for retroactive effect on pending actions.

476.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
476.title: City of Clearwater, Pinellas County
476.description: Provides for use & development of specified city-owned lands; removes certain restrictions on use of lands imposed by ch. 11050, Laws of Florida (1925); specifies that act does not modify or supersede city's charter relating to waterfront property owned by city.

477.title: Retirement
477.description: Revises method for determining cost-of-living adjustment of benefits for retirees & annuitants of FRS on & after specified date; provides declaration of important state interest.

478.title: Specialty License Plates/Safe and Free Florida
478.description: Directs DHSMV to develop Safe & Free Florida license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; provides for administration & distribution of funds by DLA; requires organizations receiving funds to make annual attestation of use of funds; directs DLA to adopt rules.

479.title: Millage Rates
479.description: Revises procedures to be used by taxing authorities before & after adopting final millage rate & budget.

480.title: Reemployment Assistance Fraud
480.description: Adds DEO as entity that may be issued reproductions from certain files or digital records for specified reasons; provides for disqualification from eligibility for reemployment benefits for specified period of time determined by number of incidents of false or fraudulent representation; extends such disqualification period if such representation is made in furtherance specified felony; expands definition of term "racketeering activity" to include knowingly making false statements or representations or knowingly failing to disclose material fact to obtain or increase benefits or other payments under ch. 443, F.S., & other specified laws.

481.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
481.title: Tax-and-surcharge-free Cigarettes
481.description: Authorizes recognized Indian tribes to use excess Indian-tax-and-surcharge-exemption coupons when selling cigarettes to nontribal members on the reservation.

482.title: Award of Attorney Fees in Public Records Enforcement Actions
482.description: Revises conditions under which award of attorney fees is authorized in certain civil actions for enforcement of chapter 119, F.S.; provides that award of such attorney fees is within discretion of court.

483.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee
483.title: Railroads
483.description: Requires Class II railroad companies to develop critical incident stress plans.

484.title: Public Records/Utility Security Information
484.description: Defines term "utility"; provides exemption from public records requirements for information related to security of information technology systems or industrial control technology systems of utility owned or operated by local government; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

485.title: Public Records/Baker Act Court Proceedings
485.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain records of court proceedings for involuntary examination & treatment under Baker Act; permitting clerk of court to allow certain persons access to such records; provides applicability; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

486.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
486.title: Salvage Motor Vehicle Transactions
486.description: Requires motor vehicle dealers & independent entities engaged in sale of salvage vehicles to obtain, record, & maintain certain information; requires DHSMV to contract with third party data consolidator to develop database for submission of transaction information to National Motor Vehicle Title Information System; requires purchasers to report certain information to department.

487.title: Prearrest Diversion Programs
487.description: Encourages local communities & public or private educational institutions to implement prearrest diversion programs for certain offenders; authorizes law enforcement officers of participating agencies to issue civil citations to adults; requires adult issued such citation to report for intake; requires appropriate behavioral health care services; requires that adult issued civil citation fulfill community service requirement & pay restitution; provides for criminal prosecution of adults who fail to complete program; prohibits arrest record from being associated with certain offense for adults who successfully complete program; establishes steering committee for program; requires program to share information with other such programs; specifies eligible nonviolent misdemeanor offenses.

488.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-138, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 624 (Ch. 2016-114)
488.title: Information Technology Security
488.description: Revising the membership of the Technology Advisory Council to include a cybersecurity expert; revising the duties of the Agency for State Technology; providing for the establishment of computer security incident response teams within state agencies; requiring the agency to establish an information technology policy for certain state contracts, etc.

489.last_action: Died in Government Operations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1033 (Ch. 2016-138)
489.title: Trust Funds/Creation/State Technology Security Incident Trust Fund/Agency for State Technology
489.description: Creates State Technology Security Incident Trust Fund within AST; provides for purpose & source of funds of trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

490.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1033 (Ch. 2016-138), CS/SB 624 (Ch. 2016-114)
490.title: Public Records/State Agency Information Technology Security Programs
490.description: Creates exemptions from public records requirements for certain records held by state agency which identify detection, investigation, or response practices for suspected or confirmed information technology security incidents & for certain portions of risk assessments, evaluations, external audits, & other reports of state agency's information technology program; authorizes disclosure of confidential & exempt information to certain agencies & officers; provides for retroactive application; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statements of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

491.title: Babcock Ranch Community Independent Special District, Charlotte and Lee Counties
491.description: Expands district boundaries of Babcock Ranch Community Independent Special District to include areas of Lee County; requires referendum.

493.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 936 (Ch. 2016-175)
493.title: Interviews of Victims, Suspects, or Defendants with Autism Spectrum Disorder
493.description: Designates act "Wes Kleinert Fair Interview Act"; requires qualified professional or relative or caretaker of certain individuals to assist law enforcement officer, correctional officer, or other public safety official during interviews in specified circumstances; provides responsibility for payment of related expenses; prohibits failure to have qualified professional, relative, or caretaker present from serving as basis for specified actions; requires agencies to develop & implement appropriate policies & procedures & provide training.

494.title: Certified School Counselors
494.description: Requires schools to have minimum number of full-time certified school counselors; provides counselor qualifications; requires specified services; requires counselors to follow specific standards.

495.title: Community Schools Initiative
495.description: Requires DOE to implement "Reigniting Education Achievement with Coordinated Help" (REACH) Program as public-private partnership in lowest-performing public schools; specifies services to be offered with goal of improving student academic achievement.

496.title: Pay-for-success Contracts
496.description: Establishes pay-for-success contract program within DMS; authorizes DMS to negotiate & enter into pay-for-success contracts pursuant to which certain not-for-profit entities are paid for contractual services to address certain public problems if successfully achieved according to independent evaluation; directs EDR to provide certain assistance to DMS; exempts pay-for-success contracts from competitive procurement requirements; authorizes DMS to develop model contracts & adopt rules.

497.title: Anchoring Limitation Areas
497.description: Prohibits overnight anchoring of vessels in specified anchoring limitation areas; provides exceptions, applicability, & penalties; authorizes law enforcement officers & agencies to remove & impound vessels; provides indemnification for such law enforcement officers & agencies in certain circumstances; provides requirements for contractors performing removal or impoundment activities; provides for issuance of citations & expiration.

498.title: Independent Postsecondary Educational Institutions
498.description: Revises provisions relating to Commission for Independent Education & institutions licensed by commission, licensure of such institutions, financial requirements of such institutions, continuing education for certain personnel at such institutions, Student Protection Fund, & criminal penalties for unlawful closure of such institutions; creates Closed Institution Panel within commission; creates accountability measures for institutions licensed by commission.

499.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
499.title: Florida Black Bears
499.description: Requires FWCC, DACS, & DEP to enforce certain provisions, adopted rules, & issued orders; creates Bear-Resistant Garbage Container Account within Nongame Wildlife Trust Fund; requires FWCC to establish process through which certain local governments may obtain loans to purchase bear-resistant garbage containers; prohibits harvesting of saw palmetto berries & sale of timber rights on state lands identified as Florida black bear habitat; requires burn schedules for state forests & parks containing Florida black bear habitat to be adjusted to meet certain conditions; requires FWCC to designate Florida black bear habitat & post such areas on website.

501.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
501.title: City of Lauderhill, Broward County
501.description: Provides conditions under which neighborhood improvement district may borrow money contract loans, & issue bonds, certificates, warrants, notes, or other evidence of indebtedness & may pledge special assessment power of district to pay such debts for purpose of financing certain capital projects.

502.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-139, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1063 (Ch. 2016-97)
502.title: Nurse Licensure Compact
502.description: Creates Nurse Licensure Compact; provides for recognition of licenses in party states; provides requirements for obtaining & retaining multistate license; provides effect on current licensees; requires all party states to participate in coordinated licensure information system of all RNs & LPNs; provides for development of system, reporting procedures, & exchange of certain information between party states; establishes Interstate Commission of Nurse Licensure Compact Administrators; authorizes certain disciplinary action under compact for certain prohibited acts; requires Florida Center for Nursing to analyze supply & demand of nurses & make future projections; requires DOH to report significant investigative information on nurse licensee to coordinated licensure information system; requires nurse holding multistate license to report participation in treatment program to department; provides eligibility criteria for multistate license.

503.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-97, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1061 (Ch. 2016-139)
503.title: Public Records and Meetings/Nurse Licensure Compact
503.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain information held by DOH or Board of Nursing pursuant to Nurse Licensure Compact; provides exemption from public meeting requirements for certain meetings of Interstate Commission of Nurse Licensure Compact Administrators; provides exemption from public records requirements for recordings, minutes, & records generated during closed portions of such meetings; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

504.title: Compensation for Personal Injury or Wrongful Death Arising from a Medical Injury
504.description: Provides exclusive remedy for personal injury or wrongful death arising from medical injury; provides exceptions; creates Patient Compensation System; provides for various offices & committees; provides for independent medical review panels; prohibits certain conflicts of interest; provides process for filing application & for disposition of application; provides for determination of compensation when there is sufficient proof of medical injury; provides for review of appeals by administrative law judge; requires annual contributions from specified providers; provides for provider opt out; requires annual report.

505.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
505.title: Voter Registration
505.description: Revises procedures governing voter registration by DHSMV; provides that driver license or identification card applications, license or identification card renewal applications, & address updates for existing driver licenses or identification cards submitted to department serve as voter registration applications; specifies that applicant consents to use of his or her signature for voter registration purposes; requires specified applications to include voter registration component; specifies required content for voter registration component; provides for paper-based applications; requires supervisor of elections to provide notification of registration to each applicant; provides that applicant is registered if he or she fails to respond to notification within specified timeframe; requires supervisor to forward declinations to statewide voter registration system.

506.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 589 (Ch. 2016-130)
506.title: Water Resources
506.description: Directs DOT to establish a Water and Wastewater Utilities Relocation Study Committee; provides committee membership, duties, reporting requirements, & expiration; transfers review of water management district rules from Florida Land & Water Adjudicatory Commission to DEP; provides review procedures & standards; repeals provisions relating to supplemental damages connected with consumptive use permit violations; provides retroactive applicability.

507.title: South Broward Hospital District, Broward County
507.description: Revises authority of district's board of commissioners to invest funds; authorizes investments listed in investment policy adopted by board & deletes list of authorized investments.

508.last_action: Died in Judiciary Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 184 (Ch. 2016-242)
508.title: Military Support
508.description: Requires landlord, condominium association, cooperative association, or homeowners' association to complete processing of rental application submitted by servicemember within specified timeframe; provides applicability.

509.title: State Areas
509.description: Creates, revises, & deletes provisions relating to acquisition, surplus, sale, lease, & use of state-owned conservation, nonconservation, recreation, & submerged lands; provides appropriation & authorizes positions.

510.title: Convenience Business Security
510.description: Removes exclusion from definition of term "convenience business" for businesses in which owner or members of his or her family work between specified hours; revises contents of notice concerning amount of cash available; exempts businesses in which owner or members of his or her family work between specified hours from specified requirements; removes administrative fee for approval & reapproval for robbery deterrence & safety training curricula.

511.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 698 (Ch. 2016-190), HB 7099 (Ch. 2016-220)
511.title: Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco
511.description: Revises licensing or permitting requirements for sale of alcoholic beverages, cigarettes, & other tobacco products by specified vendors under certain conditions; provides reporting requirements.

512.title: North Sumter County Hospital District, Sumter County
512.description: Abolishes district; transfers assets & liabilities to Sumter County.

513.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-140, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62), HB 5101 (Ch. 2016-65), CS/HB 7003 (Ch. 2016-3)
513.title: Agency for Persons with Disabilities
513.description: Repealing provisions relating to a program for the prevention and treatment of severe self-injurious behavior; providing for the assignment of priority to clients waiting for waiver services; adding client needs that qualify as extraordinary needs, which may result in the approval of an increase in a client's allocated funds; providing qualification requirements for the supervisor of the clinical director of a specified licensee, etc.

514.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee
514.title: Motor Fuel Tax Agreement with the Seminole Tribe of Florida
514.description: Requires DOR to negotiate & execute motor fuel tax agreement between state & Seminole Tribe of Florida, Inc.; requires ratification of agreement by Legislature; specifies criteria for inclusion in agreement.

515.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 231 (Ch. 2016-77)
515.title: Protection of Motor Vehicle Dealers' Consumer Data
515.description: Requires that licensee or third party comply with certain restrictions on reuse or disclosure of consumer data received from motor vehicle dealer, that upon request of motor vehicle dealer, licensee provide list of consumer data obtained & all persons to whom data has been disclosed, & that licensee indemnify motor vehicle dealer for certain claims or damages.

516.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 628 (Ch. 2016-162)
516.title: Criminal History Information
516.description: Provides reduced fee for criminal history information provided to Agency for Persons with Disabilities under specified provisions.

517.title: Advertisement of Vehicle and Metals Purchasing
517.description: Requires person to be licensed by DHSMV as motor vehicle dealer to advertise for purchase or sale of motor vehicles; requires motor vehicle dealer advertisements to include certain information; prohibits unlicensed person from using certain vehicles to transport certain vehicles; provides for impoundment of wrecker or tow truck used in violation of licensure requirements; requires persons who advertise to provide services as secondary metals recycler to be registered with Department of Revenue; requires secondary metals recycler advertisements to include certain information; prohibits person not registered as secondary metals recycler from using wrecker or tow truck to transport certain metals; provides for impoundment of wrecker or tow truck used in violation of registration requirements; provides penalties.

518.title: Prescription Drug Coverage
518.description: Prohibits health insurance policy, health care services plan, or other contract from excluding pharmacy or pharmacist from such policy, plan, or contract under certain conditions.

519.title: Prevention of Acts of War
519.description: Prohibits state, political subdivisions, agencies & employees, & persons receiving state funds from assisting with entry into or resettlement in state of certain foreign refugees & immigrants; requires persons offering resettlement assistance to foreign refugees or immigrants through certain resettlement assistance programs to submit personal identifying information of such refugees & immigrants to FDLE; directs FDLE to conduct background screenings & report specified information to Governor, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, & certain persons; authorizes Governor to exercise certain powers; provides for assessment & payment of certain fees; authorizes Governor & Attorney General to challenge specified federal laws & regulations; directs Governor & Attorney General to prevent entry into or resettlement in state of certain restricted persons.

520.title: Insurance Claims
520.description: Provides requirements under property insurance policy for post-loss assignment of claims or policy provisions not related to liability coverage; provides requirements for an agreement to assign such claims; provides limitations on assignee's rights to collect money from, sue, or claim lien on property of, policyholder; revises timeframe for paying undisputed benefits owed under first-party property insurance policies; authorizes an insurer to require notice of loss within specified time; revises timeframes for an insurer to acknowledge communications, begin investigations, & pay or deny claims; authorizes insurer to limit scope of certain repairs; revises Homeowner Claims Bill of Rights to conform to changes made by act.

521.title: Public Records/Trade Secret Information in Annual Recycling Reports
521.description: Exempts from public records requirements trade secret information in annual recycling reports submitted by private businesses to counties; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

522.title: Specialty License Plates/I Stand With Israel
522.description: Directs DHSMV to develop I Stand With Israel license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plates.

524.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 936 (Ch. 2016-175)
524.title: Identification Cards
524.description: Requires DHSMV to issue ID card exhibiting special designation for person who has developmental disability; requires payment of additional fee & proof of diagnosis by licensed physician; requires fee to be deposited into APD Operations & Maintenance Trust Fund.

525.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
525.title: Alcoholic Beverages/Powdered Alcohol
525.description: Prohibits sale, offer for sale, purchase, use, offer for use, or possession of powdered alcohol; provides exemption for use of powdered alcohol by specified entities for research purposes; provides exemption for possession of powdered alcohol solely for purpose of transportation through this state by specified entities.

526.title: Compensation of Employees of Nongovernmental Organizations, Quasi-Governmental Entities, and Not-for-Profit Organizations
526.description: Provides limitation on salaries of employees of certain nongovernmental organizations, quasi-governmental entities, & not-for-profit organizations; requires approval by Legislative Budget Commission for salaries that exceed limitation; provides requirements relating to use of appropriated funds for administrative costs, including salaries; provides that certain organizations & entities are ineligible for state-appropriated funds, including state-appropriated federal funds, under certain conditions.

527.title: Law Enforcement and Correctional Officers
527.description: Provides legislative intent concerning salary parity for law enforcement & correctional facility officers.

528.title: Continuing Education Requirements for Health Care Practitioners
528.description: Provides requirements for instruction of certain health care practitioners concerning identification & reporting of child abuse; requires completion of domestic violence & child abuse instruction as part of biennial relicensure or recertification.

529.title: Use of Deadly Force
529.description: Requires law enforcement agency to collect & report certain information regarding use of deadly force to FDLE; specifies information to be collected & reported; requires FDLE to provide agency with standardized form for reporting information & to provide for electronic submission of information; specifies minimum retention period for information; requires FDLE, in consultation with specified associations, to develop & maintain database for retention of information.

530.title: Children's Medical Services
530.description: Requires DOH to develop instrument to determine clinical eligibility for CMS program; specifies minimum requirements for clinical eligibility; provides for appeal of determination of clinical ineligibility; provides exemption from regional specialty plan enrollment limits for CMS Network.

531.last_action: Died in Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations Subcommittee
531.title: Tolls
531.description: Requires toll facility to ensure presence of signage notifying drivers if cash payment is not option; requires rental car company that imposes fee for use of electronic toll payment device to disclose applicable terms & conditions in rental agreement or disclosure statement & post such information in certain locations.

532.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
532.title: City of Fort Lauderdale, Broward County
532.description: Prohibits anchorage of vessels in certain areas; provides civil penalties.

533.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
533.title: Tax Exemptions for Plug-In Electric Vehicles
533.description: Exempts sale of certain new plug-in electric vehicles, up to specified dollar value, from sales & use tax; provides sunset date.

534.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-98, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7053 (Ch. 2016-238)
534.title: Eligibility for Employment as Child Care Personnel
534.description: Provides criteria for disqualification from employment for child care personnel; requires that certain persons who have been granted an exemption from disqualification from child care employment be rescreened by specified date; provides applicability with respect to specified provisions adopted during same legislative session.

535.title: Resale of Tickets
535.description: Prohibits operator of place of entertainment or operator's agent from restricting resale of tickets or denying access to ticketholder; provides for construction; authorizes operator or operator's agent to revoke or restrict tickets.

537.title: Applicability of Revenue Laws to Out-of-state Businesses During Disaster-Response Periods
537.description: Provides exemptions from certain registration & licensing requirements & taxes for out-of-state businesses & employees that enter the state in response to disasters or emergencies; specifies applicability of certain transaction taxes & fees; specifies obligations & privileges of out-of-state businesses or employees after disaster-response periods.

538.title: Educational Accountability
538.description: Revises definition of "Learning Gains" & calculation of certain learning gains; requires schools and school districts to receive school or district grade or school improvement rating of "Incomplete" for 2014-2015 school year, as applicable.

539.title: Abuse of a Parent
539.description: Defines "child" & "parent" for purposes of crimes of abuse of parent, aggravated abuse of parent, exploitation of parent's assets, & emotional abuse of parent; provides elements of such crimes; authorizes alternative sentencing; requires reporting of abuse of parent or exploitation of parent's assets to central abuse hotline; provides immunity for person who files, or participates in investigation resulting from, such report.

541.title: Specialty License Plates/Ronald Reagan
541.description: Directs DHSMV to develop Ronald Reagan license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plates.

542.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
542.title: Florida Clean Indoor Air Act
542.description: Revises definition of "smoking" to include nicotine dispensing devices.

543.title: Theft
543.description: Increases minimum monetary value that must be attributed to certain property for theft of such property to reach threshold for prosecution as felony of third degree or misdemeanor of first degree; authorizes law enforcement officer who has probable cause to believe that offender has committed retail theft to issue notice to appear in lieu of arresting offender; authorizes state attorney to establish retail theft diversion program; provides eligibility criteria; requires participant in diversion program to complete specified conditions; authorizes state attorney to collect fee from each participant.

544.title: Character-development Instruction
544.description: Requires character-development programs to provide certain instruction to students in grades 9-12.

545.title: Alternative Sanctioning
