545.description: Authorizes chief judge of each judicial circuit, in consultation with specified entities, to establish alternative sanctioning program; authorizes offender who allegedly commits technical violation of supervision to waive participation in or elect to participate in program, admit to violation, agree to comply with recommended sanction, & agree to waive certain rights; authorizes court to impose recommended sanction or direct DOC to submit violation report, affidavit, & warrant to court; specifies that offender's participation in alternative sanctioning program is voluntary.

546.title: Parentage
546.description: Requires DOH to prepare, file, & issue new certificate of live birth under specified circumstances; requires new certificate of live birth to bear specified reference & contain designation of relationship.

547.title: Public Records/Recreational Activities Licenses/FWCC
547.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information provided to FWCC on applications for certain licenses, permits, & certifications; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

548.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
548.title: Membership Associations
548.description: Defines "membership association"; requires membership association to file annual report with Legislature; specifies contents of report; prohibits membership association from expending public funds on litigation against state; requires Auditor General to audit membership associations.

549.title: Postsecondary Education for Veterans
549.description: Directs DOE to award postsecondary course credit for specified training, education, examinations & tests; revises residency requirement for certain tuition waivers for recipients of specified military decorations; provides that specified programs & test scores meet certain educator certification requirements.

550.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
550.title: Water Oversight and Planning
550.description: Establishes Water Oversight & Planning Board to address state water issues; provides membership for board; provides duties of board; requires board to submit long-range plans to DEP, water management districts, Governor & Legislature; requires board to provide findings & recommendations to Governor & Legislature.

551.title: Prescription Medication
551.description: Revises requirements for written prescription for medicinal drug issued by licensed health care practitioner, dispensing of complimentary packages of medicinal drugs by licensed health care practitioner, ordering & dispensing of medicinal drugs by licensed pharmacist, & dispensing of controlled substance by licensed pharmacist & practitioner to include medical condition for which drug is prescribed.

552.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1422 (Ch. 2016-206), CS/CS/SB 1416 (Ch. 2016-205)
552.title: Insurer Regulatory Reporting
552.description: Requires insurer to maintain risk management framework; provides requirements for preparation & submission of an own-risk & solvency assessment summary report; provides exemptions & waivers; requires certain insurers & members of an insurance group to prepare & submit corporate governance annual disclosure; requires initial corporate governance annual disclosure to be submitted to OIR by specified date; authorizes office to require an insurer or insurance group to provide corporate governance annual disclosure; specifies requirements for preparing & annually filing corporate governance annual disclosure; specifies privilege requirements & prohibitions for certain filings & related documents; authorizes OIR to retain third-party consultants for certain purposes; authorizes FSC to adopt rules; revises provisions relating to penalties to conform to act; provides for contingent repeal of act; provides for contingent effect.

553.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1416 (Ch. 2016-205), CS/CS/SB 1422 (Ch. 2016-206)
553.title: Pub. Rec./Office of Insurance Regulation
553.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain reports & documents submitted to OIR related to own-risk & solvency assessment by insurer or insurance group; provides exemption from public records requirements for corporate governance annual disclosure & supporting documents submitted to OIR; revises actuarial board to which OIR may disclose certain information; provides for & revises future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

554.title: Firearm Violence
554.description: Increases criminal penalties for violations involving possession of firearm or ammunition when person is subject to specified injunction; provides for temporary custody of firearms by law enforcement officer at scene of domestic violence incident; provides for return of firearms after specified period.

555.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1288 (Ch. 2016-198)
555.title: Emergency Management
555.description: Defines the term "activate" for purposes of State Emergency Management Act.

556.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7016 (Ch. 2016-34)
556.title: Interstate Compact on Educational Opportunity for Military Children
556.description: Provides for payment of annual dues for Interstate Compact on Educational Opportunity for Military Children & future repeal of sections relating to compact; abrogates 2016 repeal of sections relating to compact.

557.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
557.title: Growth Management
557.description: Requires local governments to address protection of private property rights in comprehensive plans; requires comprehensive plan to include property rights element that addresses certain objectives; requires counties & municipalities to adopt land development regulations consistent with property rights element; provides deadlines for local governments to adopt private property rights element; requires state land planning agency to approve private property rights element adopted by local government if it substantially complies with specified form.

558.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-234, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 221 (Ch. 2016-222)
558.title: Transparency in Health Care
558.description: Requiring a facility licensed under ch. 395, F.S., to provide timely and accurate financial information and quality of service measures to certain individuals; requiring a health care practitioner to provide a patient upon his or her request a written or electronic good faith estimate of anticipated charges within a certain timeframe; requiring a health insurer to make available on its website certain methods that a policyholder can use to make estimates of certain costs and charges; revising a requirement that a health maintenance organization make certain information available to its subscribers, etc.

559.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
559.title: Deferred Presentment Transactions
559.description: Provides maximum amount that may be charged per annum for interest, fees, or other charges in deferred presentment transaction; prohibits engaging in device or subterfuge in order to evade specified requirements; declares that deferred presentment transaction that does not comply with specified requirements is void; declares that deferred presentment transaction in which certain interest, fees, or other charges are charged is usurious.

560.title: Criminal Offenders
560.description: Authorizes sheriffs to assess fees for registering & reregistering specified types of offenders subject to registration requirements; specifies maximum fees; provides requirements for use of fees; provides for relocation of registrants; creates designation of "serious sexual felony offender"; provides additional mandatory term of imprisonment for specified offenses committed by such offenders; requires persons convicted of specified prostitution-related offense to register as sexual offenders; prohibits failure to pay required fees; provides additional conditions to sex offender probation & community control for certain offenders & controllees who commit qualifying offenses after specified date; provides that such conditions do not need to be pronounced orally at time of sentencing; provides that such conditions may be applied to other relevant offenders; requires supervision by DOC officers who have specified training & limited caseloads.

561.title: Bad Faith Assertions of Patent Infringement
561.description: Prohibits persons from sending demand letters to targets which make bad faith assertions of patent infringement; specifies what constitutes such letters; repeals provisions requiring that plaintiffs post specified bonds;

562.title: Medical Use of Marijuana
562.description: Allows registered patients & designated caregivers to purchase, acquire, & possess medical-grade marijuana subject to specified requirements; allows cultivation & processing licensee, employee, or contractor to acquire, cultivate, transport, & sell marijuana; allows retail licensee to purchase, receive, possess, store, dispense, & deliver marijuana; prohibits certain actions regarding acquisition, possession, transfer, use, & administration of marijuana; clarifies that person is prohibited from driving under influence of marijuana; provides duties of DOH; provides implementation requirements; specifies act does not require or restrict health insurance coverage for purchase of medical-grade marijuana.

563.title: Pub. Rec./Medical Marijuana Patient Registry
563.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of patients & physicians held by DOH in electronic medical marijuana patient registry; provides exemption for information related to ordering & dispensing medical marijuana; authorizes specified persons & entities access to exempt information; requires that information released from registry remain confidential; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

564.last_action: Died in Regulated Industries, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 535 (Ch. 2016-129)
564.title: Department of Business and Professional Regulation
564.description: Deleting a requirement that yacht and ship brokers maintain a separate license for each branch office and related fees; repealing provisions relating to the duties of the Department of Business and Professional Regulation; deleting the authority of the department to reprimand, censure, or impose probation on certain business organizations; requiring injuries to racing greyhounds to be reported within a certain timeframe on a form adopted by the Division of Pari-mutuel Wagering of the department, etc.

565.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
565.title: Sales Tax Exemptions for Agricultural Equipment
565.description: Revises maximum sales price of certain farm trailers that is exempt from sales & use tax; exempts certain agricultural items from tax.

566.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
566.title: Insurance for Rented or Leased Motor Vehicles
566.description: Provides that certain actions by rental company constitute negligent entrustment; imposes duties on rental companies to ensure short-term lessees maintain certain insurance coverage; permits rental companies to sell liability insurance coverage for rental vehicles; provides construction.

567.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability
567.title: Technology
567.description: Establishes chief data officer within AST; requires chief data officer to develop an enterprise data inventory & provide recommendations for developing & maintaining open data catalog; provides definitions; provides responsibilities of chief data officer; requires agency to develop implementation plan for issuing digital proof of driver license; requires agency to submit plan to the Governor & Legislature; authorizes position for agency & agency to submit budget amendment.

568.title: Violations of Apportionment Standards
568.description: Provides that legislator who offers, or participates in creation of, apportionment plan in violation of constitutional standards for establishing congressional or legislative district boundaries may be subject to penalties; specifies methods for aggrieved party to file complaint; provides criminal penalties for legislator who in bad faith or with malice offers, or participates in creation of, apportionment plan in violation of standards.

569.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
569.title: Racing Greyhound Injuries
569.description: Requires injuries to racing greyhounds to be reported in format prescribed by DBPR's Division of Pari-mutuel Wagering within certain timeframe; specifies information that must be included in injury report; requires division to maintain reports as public records for specified time; specifies disciplinary action that may be taken against licensee of department who fails to report injury or who makes false statements in injury report.

570.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
570.title: Homestead Tax Exemptions
570.description: Authorizes property appraisers to contract for examination & audit of homestead exemption claims; specifies terms that must be included in contract; specifies prohibited & required acts by contractor; authorizes property appraiser to retain certain interest earnings; requires that certain unpaid tax liens be included in next tax roll; revises procedures regarding liens on property; provides finding of important state interest.

571.last_action: Died in Economic Affairs Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7099 (Ch. 2016-220)
571.title: Tourist Development Taxes
571.description: Specifies additional uses for revenues received from tourist development taxes for certain coastal counties.

572.title: Fumigation
572.description: Authorizing the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to adopt safety procedures for the clearance of residential structures before reoccupation after fumigation; authorizing the department to establish certain conditions for the registration or reregistration of fumigants, etc.

573.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1604 (Ch. 2016-212)
573.title: Drugs, Devices, and Cosmetics
573.description: Revises various provisions of Florida Drug & Cosmetic Act; repeals provisions relating to pedigree papers; prohibits distribution of prescription drugs without delivering transaction history, transaction information, & transaction statement; revises various permit requirements relating to prescription drug manufacturing, repackaging, & distribution; revises recordkeeping requirements; revises labeling requirements for prescription drug active pharmaceutical ingredient packaging; authorizes issuance of nondisciplinary citations.

574.title: Conveyance of Property Purchased for Airport Noise Purposes
574.description: Authorizes condemning authority to convey lands by lease or otherwise if those lands are condemned for specific noise mitigation or noise compatibility programs at certain large hub airports.

575.title: School Resource Officers and School Safety Officers
575.description: Requires, rather than authorizes, school districts to establish school resource officer programs; provides requirements for assignment of officers; specifies that auxiliary law enforcement officers may serve as school resource officers & school safety officers.

576.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
576.title: Hair Restoration or Transplant
576.description: Defines "hair restoration or transplant"; prohibits person who is not licensed or is not certified under ch. 458, F.S., ch. 459, F.S., or s. 464.012, F.S., from performing hair restoration or transplant or making incisions for purpose of performing hair restoration or transplant.

577.title: Veterans' Employment
577.description: Requires state agencies, & authorizes political subdivisions of state, to develop & implement veterans' recruitment plan; requires DMS to collect specified data & include such data in its annual workforce report & on its website; provides applicability.

578.title: Barron Water Control District, Glades and Hendry Counties
578.description: Abrogates scheduled abolition of Barron Water Control District.

579.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
579.title: Weather Impacts
579.description: Creates interagency workgroup to share information, coordinate ongoing efforts, & collaborate on initiatives relating to weather events; provides for specified agencies to select liaisons to workgroup; designates DEM director or designee as liaison & workgroup coordinator; requires workgroup to prepare specified annual report; requires workgroup to submit annual report to Governor & Legislature; requires DEM director or designee to post annual report on DEM's website; requires each agency liaison to post report on agency's website.

580.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1470 (Ch. 2016-208)
580.title: Crustaceans
580.description: Revises administrative penalties for violations related to stone crab traps & spiny lobster traps; prohibits possession of undersized spiny lobsters by certain persons; specifies that each undersized spiny lobster may be charged as separate offense; specifies criminal & administrative penalties for violations related to undersized spiny lobsters; revises offense severity ranking chart to include certain violations related to stone crabs & spiny lobsters.

581.title: Correctional Work Programs
581.description: Removes provisions of part II of ch. 946, F.S., relating to leased or managed work programs; authorizes DOC to create & operate correctional work programs; provides for evaluation & assignment of inmates to such programs; provides for sale of goods & services produced in correctional work programs; prohibits state agencies from purchasing goods & services from other sources in certain circumstances if correctional work programs produce comparable goods & services; exempts sales to government entities from specified purchasing provisions; authorizes DOC to provide inmate services or inmate goods to private enterprises in certain circumstances; prohibits sale of goods made by inmates except when in compliance with specified provisions; provides for rights of inmates; specifies that inmates are not state employees; authorizes DOC to contract with private sector to establish prison industry enhancement programs; creates Prison Industry Board of Directors; provides for membership, terms, meetings, & compensation of board; provides for powers & duties of board & DOC.

582.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1432 (Ch. 2016-207)
582.title: Process and Service of Process
582.description: Provides for service of process when only address discoverable through public records for person to be served is virtual office or executive or mini office suite; provides that orders issued by agencies of other states are not enforceable in certain circumstances.

583.title: Federal Home Loan Banks
583.description: Authorizes OFR to furnish certain information relating to Federal Home Loan Banks pursuant to information sharing agreement; requires OFR to execute such agreement by specified date.

584.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1534 (Ch. 2016-210)
584.title: Housing Assistance
584.description: Provides duties of State Office on Homelessness; directs State Office on Homelessness to create task force to make recommendations regarding implementation of statewide Homeless Management Information System; revises grant award requirements; revises requirements for local homeless assistance continuum of care plan; provides requirements for Rapid ReHousing; prohibits county or eligible municipality from expending its portion of local housing distribution to provide ongoing rent subsidies; provides that certain partnership process of State Housing Initiatives Partnership Program should involve lead agencies of local homeless assistance continuums of care; encourages counties & eligible municipalities to develop strategy within their local housing assistance plans which provides program funds for reducing homelessness; prohibits housing authority from applying for seize projects, units, or vouchers of another established housing authority.

585.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
585.title: Proceedings Relating to Children
585.description: Specifies additional inquiries to be made at shelter hearings; requires that specified inquiries relating to unknown identity or location of parent in connection with petition for dependency or shelter or in connection with termination of parental rights be conducted under oath; specifies additional information to be inquired about; requires search of Florida Putative Father Registry; provides for scientific testing to determine maternity or paternity; provides that if diligent search fails to identify & locate prospective parent, court may proceed without further notice; provides that that, where there has been dependency trial as to one parent, DCF's demonstration of risk of harm to child by second parent allows court to make supplemental findings & order case plan as to second parent; revises requirements for adjudicatory hearings.

587.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-145, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 423 (Ch. 2016-224)
587.title: Ordering of Medication
587.description: Providing that a pharmacist may dispense an emergency opioid antagonist pursuant to a non-patient-specific standing order for an autoinjection delivery system or intranasal application delivery system; revising the authority of a licensed physician assistant to order medication under the direction of a supervisory physician for a specified patient; revising the term "prescription" to exclude an order for drugs or medicinal supplies dispensed for administration; authorizing a licensed practitioner to authorize a licensed physician assistant or advanced registered nurse practitioner to order controlled substances for a specified patient under certain circumstances, etc.

588.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
588.title: Property Insurance
588.description: Prohibits Citizens Property Insurance Corporation from imposing 30-day waiting period for insurance policy to become effective under certain conditions.

589.title: Medicaid Provider Overpayments
589.description: Authorizes AHCA to certify that Medicaid provider is out of business & that overpayments made to provider cannot be collected under state law; revises method for verifying vendor delivery of home health services under home health agency monitoring pilot project.

590.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
590.title: Designation of State River/St. Johns River
590.description: Designates St. Johns River as official state river.

591.title: Crash Reports
591.description: Provides that law enforcement officer may testify in civil proceeding concerning statements made by person involved in crash.

592.title: Elections
592.description: Establishes election alert system for certain purposes; provides system requirements; requires absentee ballots to be provided with postage prepaid, preaddressed return envelope; provides for Division of Elections to reimburse counties for certain costs; revises requirements for return of absentee ballots; requires Department of State to establish rules relating to return of absentee ballots.

593.title: Early Childhood Music Education Incentive Pilot Program
593.description: Creates Early Childhood Music Education Incentive Pilot Program within DOE; provides for participation, program requirements, funding & incentive payments, & rulemaking; requires UF's College of Education to perform evaluation; provides for expiration.

594.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
594.title: Charter Schools
594.description: Authorizes municipal governing authority to become charter school sponsor in certain circumstance; requires municipal governing authority to make timely & efficient payment & reimbursement to charter schools; requires certain charter schools to secure a security bond of a certain amount; deletes prohibition against high-performing charter schools establishing more than one charter school per year.

595.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
595.title: Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University Industrial Hemp Program
595.description: Authorizes FAMU to engage in certain research related to industrial hemp under certain conditions; creates Industrial Hemp Program at FAMU; provides program purpose; requires FAMU to establish Office of Hemp Research Compliance; provides for rulemaking.

596.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
596.title: Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program
596.description: Revises provisions relating to qualifications of prekindergarten instructors employed by private prekindergarten provider & pre- and post-assessment administered to students enrolled in VPK; provides that private prekindergarten providers meeting certain criteria are eligible for additional funding in GAA.

597.title: Diabetes Educator Practice
597.description: Creates "Diabetes Educators Practice Act"; provides that Dietetics & Nutrition Practice Council, under Board of Medicine, is responsible for licensing, monitoring, & disciplining diabetes educators.

598.title: Real Property
598.description: Requires district water or sewer system or municipality that imposes lien to provide Internet-based procedure to provide estoppel certificate; provides criteria for certificate; provides waiver of right to lien; provides that certain liens against real property are invalid unless recorded; provides requirements for application for certain building permits; revises notice of commencement form for improving real property; provides for expiration & renewal of certain building permits.

599.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-261, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1267 (Ch. 2016-262)
599.title: Greater Naples Fire Rescue District, Collier County

601.title: Adult Cardiovascular Services
601.description: Expanding rulemaking criteria for the Agency for Health Care Administration for licensure of hospitals performing percutaneous cardiac intervention procedures, etc.

602.title: Damages Recoverable for the Cost of Medical or Health Care Services
602.description: Provides for calculation of damages for certain medical or health care services paid or owed by claimant or governmental or commercial insurance payor; provides that individual contracts between providers & licensed commercial insurers or licensed HMOs are not subject to discovery or disclosure & not admissible in certain actions; provides that amount of lien or subrogation claim asserted by Medicaid, Medicare, or payor regulated under Florida Insurance Code for certain past medical expenses, in addition to amount of copayments or deductibles payable by claimant, is maximum amount recoverable & admissible into evidence; provides applicability.

603.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Appropriations Subcommittee
603.title: Manatees
603.description: Exempts, until specified date, revenues deposited in Save the Manatee Trust Fund from certain service charges; authorizes expenditure of such funds to conduct manatee speed zone study & statewide manatee distribution & abundance surveys & reports; requires FWCC to contract for manatee speed zone effectiveness study; requires FWCC to submit report detailing findings of such study to Governor & Legislature & to conduct surveys & reports; authorizes FWCC to conduct additional surveys & reports as necessary.

604.title: Domestic Partnerships
604.description: Requires facility providing mental health services to authorize access to patient by domestic partner; establishes requirements for domestic partnership; identifies rights afforded to domestic partners; provides for termination of domestic partnership; authorizes domestic partner to serve as health care proxy.

605.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee
605.title: Licensure of Foreign-Trained Physicians
605.description: Establishes licensure requirements for certain foreign-trained physicians; authorizes Board of Medicine to impose licensure restrictions, limitations, or conditions on certain foreign-trained physicians.

606.last_action: Died in Justice Appropriations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1322 (Ch. 2016-152)
606.title: Juvenile Detention Costs
606.description: Revises annual contributions by certain counties for costs of detention care for juveniles; revises methodology by which DJJ determines percentage share for each county; requires state to pay all costs of detention care for juveniles residing out of state & for certain postdisposition detention care; removes requirement that DOR & counties provide certain technical assistance to DJJ; revises applicability of specified provisions.

607.title: Autism Awareness Training for Law Enforcement Officers
607.description: Requires FDLE to establish continued employment training component relating to autism spectrum disorder; specifies instruction to be included in training component; provides that completion of training may count toward continued employment instruction requirements.

608.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
608.title: Mitigation Banks
608.description: Provides exemption from mitigation bank requirements for impacts from mining construction aggregate materials & removal & management of exotic plant species.

609.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
609.title: Insurance Coverage for Mental and Nervous Disorders
609.description: Mandates certain coverage for mental & nervous disorders under specified health insurance policies or contracts & revises required benefits for such coverage.

610.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
610.title: Vacation Rental Units
610.description: Provides criteria for licensure as vacation rental unit; requires DBPR's Division of Hotels & Restaurants to suspend license for failure to meet all criteria; specifies that vacation rental units operating without license or with license expired for specified period are subject to disciplinary action pursuant to rules establishing certain disciplinary guidelines; prohibits group licensing of such units; requires vacation rental unit to display its license number on all property rental advertising; provides that it is an unlicensed practice to advertise without license.

611.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 1602 (Ch. 2016-211)
611.title: Elevators
611.description: Designates provisions as "Maxwell Erik 'Max' Grablin Act"; provides clearance requirements for elevators installed in private residences; requires certain doors & gates to withstand specified amount of force; requires that certain doors reject sphere of a specified size under certain circumstances; requires all such elevators to be equipped with certain device; directs Florida Building Commission to adopt provisions into Florida Building Code.

612.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
612.title: Original Works of Art
612.description: Provides exemption from sales & use tax for certain types of original works of art; authorizes DOR to adopt emergency rules; provides repeal date for authorization to adopt emergency rules.

613.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
613.title: Newborn Adrenoleukodystrophy Screening
613.description: Directs DOH to expand statewide screening of newborns to include screening for adrenoleukodystrophy within specified period after adrenoleukodystrophy is adopted for inclusion on federal recommended uniform screening panel.

614.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
614.title: Listings for Vacation Rental Property
614.description: Requires person engaged in leasing, renting, letting, or granting licenses for use of vacation rentals to display valid certificate of registration number in each rental listing or advertisement; provides penalties.

617.title: Use or Operation of a Drone by Certain Offenders
617.description: Prohibits use or operation of drone by certain offenders for purpose of viewing or recording image of minor in specified locations.

618.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1386 (Ch. 2016-202)
618.title: Insurance Agents
618.description: Revises fee & commission limitations for health insurance agents; clarifies qualifications for licensure as life agent; increases amount of coverage allowed for certain life insurance policies covering funeral expenses.

619.title: Emergency Allergy Treatment in Schools
619.description: Authorizes public school & private school, respectively, to enter into certain arrangements with wholesale distributors or manufacturers for epinephrine auto-injectors.

621.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
621.title: Sexual Offenses Involving Postsecondary Students
621.description: Requires that law enforcement agencies report certain sexual offenses involving postsecondary students to designated official at postsecondary institution; requires specified postsecondary institutions to require that information on sexual assault be included in course syllabi.

622.title: Postsecondary Education Fees
622.description: Requires state universities to waive specific fees for graduate students with certain appointments.

623.last_action: Original bill laid on Table, refer to combined CS for CS/CS/HB 307 and HB 1313
623.title: Low-THC Cannabis for Medical Use
623.description: Revises definitions; revises requirements for physicians ordering low-THC cannabis; provides that physician who orders low-THC cannabis & receives related compensation from dispensing organization may be subject to disciplinary action; revises requirements relating to physician education; requires DOH to include specified information in online compassionate use registry; revises requirements for dispensing organizations; specifies duties & responsibilities of DOH; authorizes approved laboratory & its employees to possess, test, transport, & lawfully dispose of low-THC cannabis or paraphernalia in certain circumstances; exempts approved dispensing organization & related persons from Florida Drug & Cosmetic Act.

624.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
624.title: Concussions and Head Injuries in Students
624.description: Requires certain medical personnel to undergo continuing education relating to concussions & head injuries in children; requires independent sanctioning authorities & FHSAA to refer certain students to concussion oversight team; prohibits certain students from returning to athletic practice or competition & classroom instruction until certain requirements are met; requires each school district to create concussion oversight team for certain public & private school students; provides for team membership, team duties, requirements for return to athletic practice or competition & classroom instruction, & rulemaking.

625.title: Interstate Purchase of Health Insurance
625.description: Allows foreign insurer to offer individual health insurance for sale in state upon meeting certain requirements; establishes requirements; exempts foreign insurer from Florida Insurance Code.

626.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1202 (Ch. 2016-196)
626.title: Discounts on Public Park Entrance Fees and Transportation Fares
626.description: Requires counties & municipalities to provide discounts on public park entrance fees to military members, veterans, & spouses & parents of certain deceased military members, law enforcement officers, firefighters, & emergency workers; requires regional transportation authorities to provide discounts on fares & charges to certain disabled veterans.

627.title: Public School Instruction
627.description: Requires instructional staff of public schools to provide instruction to certain students about responsible use of social media by specified school year; requires Commissioner of Education to provide school districts with certain information.

629.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1274 (Ch. 2016-197)
629.title: Limited Sinkhole Coverage Insurance
629.description: Authorizes insurers to issue insurance policies that provide coverage for sinkhole losses on residential properties.

630.last_action: Died in Health Quality Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1604 (Ch. 2016-212)
630.title: Drug Safety
630.description: Requires pharmacies to offer for sale prescription lock boxes; requires pharmacies to display a certain sign; defines "prescription lock box"; requires DOH to develop & distribute pamphlet; requires pamphlet to contain certain information; requires pharmacists to distribute pamphlet in certain circumstances; prohibits pharmacy from charging fee for pamphlet.

631.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 636 (Ch. 2016-72)
631.title: Forensic Examination Evidence
631.description: Requires that forensic examination evidence collected be submitted to FDLE within specified timeframe for entry into statewide DNA database; requires department to return such evidence to local or investigating law enforcement agency for permanent retention; provides surcharge upon persons convicted of certain sexual offenses; specifies that proceeds of surcharge be used to process forensic medical evidence submitted in investigations of alleged sexual assaults; requires law enforcement agencies to adopt standards concerning forensic evidence collected in investigations of alleged sexual assaults; creates Forensic Medical Evidence Kit Task Force; requires task force to develop plan to create system that provides comprehensive forensic medical evidence kit tracking & inventory management; prohibits victim's personal identifying information from being included in system; specifies elements that must be included in plan; requires task force to develop plan to safeguard information; requires task force to make specified recommendations; requires report.

632.title: Sexual Offenders
632.description: Revises sexual predator & offender criteria; revises reporting & registration requirements; revises elements of offense of loitering or prowling by certain offenders in close proximity to children; revises provisions relating for venue for proceedings for seeking removal of requirement to register as sexual predator or offender; requires that removal of registration requirement not conflict with federal law requirement; revises requirements concerning information to be released by DOC & DJJ regarding sexual offenders being released.

633.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-147, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62)
633.title: Long-term Care Managed Care Prioritization
633.description: Requires DEA to maintain statewide wait list for enrollment for home & community-based services through Medicaid long-term care managed care program; requires the department to prioritize individuals for potential enrollment using frailty-based screening tool that provides priority score; provides for determinations regarding offers of enrollment.

634.title: Health Providers
634.description: Requires that report to DOH of allegations of sexual misconduct by licensed health care practitioner be made within specified timeframe; increases penalties for violations.

635.title: City of Webster, Sumter County
635.description: Provides charter of City of Webster; codifies, amends, repeals, & reenacts special acts relating to charter.

636.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability
636.title: State-owned Motor Vehicles
636.description: Requires DMS to prepare plan regarding centralized management of state-owned motor vehicles; requires DMS to submit plan to Governor & Legislature; requires DMS to conduct certain evaluations while developing plan; provides appropriation.

637.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
637.title: Apprenticeships
637.description: Revises provisions relating to apprenticeships, specified tuition and fees for students enrolled in an apprenticeship program; requires Florida College System institution presidents to develop & implement articulation agreements with certain apprenticeship programs; creates Florida Apprenticeship Grant Program; provides for program administrations, grant awards, program requirements, program priority, use of grant funds, & quarterly reports; creates Rapid Response Grant Program; provides for application & reporting requirements, program administration, & use of grant funds.

638.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
638.title: Ad Valorem Assessments
638.description: Revises Taxpayer's Bill of Rights regarding actual assessment practices, development, & review.

639.title: Illicit Drugs
639.description: Revises definitions relating to controlled substances; revises schedules of controlled substances; provides additional factors to be considered in determining whether substance is controlled substance analog; revises how controlled substance analog is treated for purposes of drug abuse prevention & control; authorizes local actions to abate nuisances involving two or more violations of Florida Drug & Cosmetic Act within specified period; specifies additional substances that may be deemed contraband; revises lists of precursor & essential chemicals; specifies that crimes involving misbranded drugs are "racketeering activity" for purposes of Florida RICO Act; reenacts numerous provisions.

640.title: Specialty License Plates/Specified Sororities & Fraternities
640.description: Directs DHSMV to develop certain sorority & fraternity specialty license plates; establishes annual use fee for plates; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plates.

641.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
641.title: Monroe County
641.description: Authorizes local advisory committee of School Board of Monroe County or Board of County Commissioners of Monroe County, or any political subdivision thereof, to conduct public meetings, hearings, & workshops by means of communications media technology; provides for meeting notices.

642.last_action: Died in Health Quality Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7087 (Ch. 2016-240)
642.title: Telehealth
642.description: Creates Telehealth Task Force within AHCA; requires task force to compile & analyze certain data & to conduct comparative analysis of health insurance coverage available for telehealth services & for in-person treatment; requires task force to submit report to Governor & Legislature; provides for repeal; authorizes certain licensed or certified health care professionals to provide telehealth services.

643.title: Gainesville Regional Utilities, Alachua County
643.description: Creates Gainesville Regional Utilities Authority; requires referendum.

645.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
645.title: Vocational Rehabilitation
645.description: Requires Division of Vocational Rehabilitation to initiate, by specified date, performance improvement plan designed to achieve specified goals; requires division to submit performance report annually to Governor & Legislature which includes specified information.

648.title: Competency-Based Education Pilot Program
648.description: Creates Competency-Based Education Pilot Program; provides for program participation, application requirements, exemption from specified rules, student funding, & duties of DOE.

649.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 545 (Ch. 2016-24), CS/SB 1294 (Ch. 2016-199)
649.title: Offenses Involving Minors and Vulnerable Persons
649.description: Increases maximum age at which victim or witness may be allowed to testify via CCTV rather than in courtroom in certain circumstances; includes human trafficking as underlying felony offense to support felony murder conviction; provides increased criminal penalties for human trafficking offenses if victim suffers great bodily harm, permanent disability, or permanent disfigurement; specifies that penalties for branding must be for purpose of committing offense of human trafficking; prohibits certain defense to prosecution; includes human trafficking & lewd & lascivious offenses in rules of evidence applicable to sexually-related offenses.

650.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
650.title: Labeling of Genetically Engineered Foods
650.description: Provides mandatory labeling requirements for genetically engineered raw foods & processed foods made with or derived from genetically engineered ingredients; directs DOH to adopt rules; provides for injunctive relief actions; requires court to award costs & fees under certain circumstances; specifies injunctive relief actions do not preclude civil actions for damages or personal injury.

651.title: St. Augustine-St. Johns County Airport Authority
651.description: Renames authority; provides for compensation of board members.

652.title: School Bus Safety
652.description: Provides that person who passes school bus on side that children enter & exit while school bus displays stop signal commits reckless driving; specifies that violations be punished as reckless driving violations rather than moving violations.

655.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1508 (Ch. 2016-209), CS/CS/HB 7061 (Ch. 2016-239)
655.title: Airport Zoning Law of 1945
655.description: Revises provisions for adopting, amending, administering, & enforcing airport protection zoning regulations & airport land use compatibility zoning regulations.

656.title: Licensure of Residential Treatment Centers for Children and Adolescents
656.description: Provides applicability of specified provisions with respect to ownership, management, & administration of residential treatment center for children & adolescents; specifies requirements for medical director of such center.

657.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1106 (Ch. 2016-192)
657.title: Transactions with Foreign Financial Institutions
657.description: Requires chartered financial institutions with certain correspondent or payable-through accounts to report specified information to OFR; provides moratorium on certain licensing requirements by OFR for organizations & entities that provide services to certain international trust entities; provides procedural requirements for application of moratorium to such organization or entity; authorizes OFR to apply other provisions of financial institutions codes; provides for expiration.

658.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1106 (Ch. 2016-192)
658.title: Pub. Rec./Limited Purpose International Trust Company Representative Offices
658.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain information held by OFR relating to limited purpose international trust company representative offices; provides for authorized release of certain information by office; authorizes publication of certain information; provides penalty; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

659.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
659.title: Waste Management
659.description: Suspends weight limits for certain solid waste & recyclable collection vehicles under certain circumstances; requires invoices for solid waste collection to list certain taxes & fees; revises provisions relating to solid waste collection services to include disposal & recycling services; authorizes certain companies to bring actions against state agencies for specified violations; deletes exception for certain local government waste collection services; requires local governments providing certain solid waste services to remit certain fees & taxes & file reports; establishes crime of theft of recyclable property; provides penalties.

660.title: Special Risk Class
660.description: Adds certified 911 public safety telecommunicators to Special Risk Class; requires such members to have their benefits calculated in accordance with provisions for Regular Class members.

662.title: Exception to Waiting Period for Purchasing and Delivering Handguns
662.description: Exempts purchase of handguns by qualified law enforcement officers or qualified retired law enforcement officers from 3-day waiting period.

663.title: Florida Public Employee Whistleblower's Act
663.description: Revises duties of Chief Inspector General & agency inspectors general; revises actions that agency or independent contractor is prohibited from taking against certain employees; provides nonapplicability of whistleblower remedies & protections to certain persons; revises requirements related to disclosure of information & methods of reporting information; revises requirements related to remedies; revises affirmative defenses; revises applicability of provisions relating to investigative procedures upon receipt of whistleblower information; revises powers & responsibilities of Chief Inspector General & agency inspector generals; revises reporting requirements; revises investigative procedures relating to prohibited personnel actions; revises complaint requirements; revises fact-finding responsibilities of FCHR; revises FCHR powers & responsibilities; provides requirements for termination of investigation.

664.title: Pub. Rec/Public Employees' Whistleblower's Act
664.description: Revises exemption from public records requirements for identities of informants & investigatory information held by Chief Inspector General, agency inspectors general, & other appropriate local officials; revises requirements providing for disclosure of confidential information to specified persons or entities; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

665.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
665.title: Pledge of Allegiance
665.description: Requires written notice of student's right not to participate in the pledge of allegiance to be included in specific publication; provides student may be excused from certain actions associated with pledge; requires unexcused students to show full respect to flag during pledge.

667.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
667.title: Greyhound Racing
667.description: Creates "Greyhound Safety Act"; prohibits Division of Pari-mutuel Wagering of DBPR from granting license or permit to applicant convicted of animal cruelty, felony aggravated assault or battery, or felony child abuse; requires division to immediately revoke license or permit of person convicted of animal cruelty; provides that division may not commence administrative proceedings & must reinstate suspended license if division cannot confirm positive test result; provides certain requirements for maintaining safe racing facilities & racetrack surfaces.

668.title: Teacher Certification Reimbursement and Loan Repayment Program
668.description: Creates Teacher Certification Reimbursement & Loan Repayment Program; provides for administration & funding of program, teacher eligibility, use of funds, & rulemaking.

669.title: Termination of Pregnancies
669.description: Revising the requirements for disposal of fetal remains; revising the criminal punishment for failure to properly dispose of fetal remains; requiring the Agency for Health Care Administration to develop and enforce rules relating to license inspections and investigations of certain clinics; requiring certain organizations that provide abortion referral services or abortion counseling services to register with the agency, pay a specified fee, and include certain

670.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
670.title: Mobile Home Park Lot Tenancies
670.description: Provides for mobile home park owner to increase lot rental of purchaser of mobile home on leased lot in mobile home park; provides limitations on amount of rent increase; provides guidelines for determining amount of adjustment; requires disclosure statement to be executed before or at time of purchase; limits amount of lot rental increase on lot that was previously subject to lifetime lease; provides penalty.

671.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
671.title: Small Business Christmas Sales Tax Holiday
671.description: Provides that tax levied under ch. 212, F.S., is not required to be collected on sale of certain tangible personal property by certain small businesses during specified period; authorizes DOR to adopt emergency rules; provides appropriation.

672.title: Hillsborough County
672.description: Revises space requirements for liquor licenses for restaurants.

673.title: Emergency Medical Air Transportation Services
673.description: Requires additional penalty to be imposed for certain moving violations; provides for distribution & use of moneys received; directs DOH to establish separate account within Emergency Medical Services Trust Fund; requires certain fees to be deposited in account to be used for specified purposes; provides conditions for increasing reimbursement for emergency medical air transportation services providers.

674.title: After-school Programs
674.description: Deletes legislative intent provision regarding certain not-for-profit organizations & background screening for such organizations; revises definition; defines term "not-for-profit organization or municipal government"; provides certain provisions do not apply to not-for-profit organizations & municipal governments; requires certain employees of not-for-profit organizations & municipal governments to meet certain background screening requirements; creates study group.

675.title: Consumer Finance Loans
675.description: Creates "Access to Responsible Credit Pilot Program" within OFR; provides requirements & conditions for lenders to make loans under the program; requires lenders & OFR to file certain reports.

676.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
676.title: Sports Franchise Facilities
676.description: Prohibits professional or semi-professional sports franchise from constructing, reconstructing, renovating, or improving a facility on leased public land; requires that any sale of public land for a sports franchise facility be at fair market value.

677.title: Florida Mission Readiness Commission
677.description: Creates Florida Mission Readiness Commission to assess readiness of infants, children, teens, & young adults to grow up to meet challenges of adulthood; requires commission to recommend public policy initiatives that increase preparedness of state's youth to enable them to fulfill their highest potential; assigns commission to DOH for administrative purposes.

678.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 423 (Ch. 2016-224)
678.title: Agency Relationships with Governmental Health Care Contractors
678.description: Extends sovereign immunity to employees or agents of health care provider that executes contract with governmental contractor.

679.title: Martin County
679.description: Repeals provisions relating to issuance of special alcoholic beverage licenses to hotels, motels, motor courts, & certain restaurants.

680.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
680.title: Village of Estero, Lee County
680.description: Specifies that vote required for adoption of proposed charter amendment must be at least 60 percent of those electors voting in election.

681.title: Port of Palm Beach District, Palm Beach County
681.description: Increases commissioner salaries; provides source for compensation; revises approval of foreign trade zones.

682.title: Hillsborough County Public Transportation Commission/Transportation Network Companies
682.description: Revises rulemaking authority for vehicle safety & equipment requirements; revises application & certification requirements to engage in business of operating handicabs in county; revises types of vehicles subject to restrictions on marks or identification; provides requirements for transportation network company services; prohibits certain acts by transportation network company drivers.

683.title: Licenses to Carry Concealed Weapons or Firearms
683.description: Removes provision prohibiting concealed carry licensees from openly carrying handgun or carrying concealed weapon or firearm into college or university facility.

684.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 498 (Ch. 2016-188)
684.title: Repeal of a Prohibition on Cohabitation
684.description: Removes provisions prohibiting cohabitation by unmarried men & women.

685.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
685.title: Public Records and Public Meetings/University Direct-Support Organizations
685.description: Deletes provision that protects identity of donor to university direct-support organization; deletes public records exemption for university direct-support organization; deletes public meetings exemption for certain meetings of university direct-support organization.

686.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 238 (Ch. 2016-67)
686.title: Medical Assistant Certification
686.description: Repeals language relating to certification of medical assistants by American Association of Medical Assistants or as Registered Medical Assistant by American Medical Technologists.

687.title: Slungshot
687.description: Deletes provisions prohibiting manufacture or sale of instrument or weapon usually known as slungshot; revises definition of term "concealed weapon" to delete inclusion of slungshot; deletes provision prohibiting dealer in arms from selling or transferring slungshot to minor.

688.title: Use of Force
688.description: Removes provisions specifying that person has no duty to retreat & has right to stand his or her ground & meet force with force in certain circumstances.

689.title: Blended Learning Courses
689.description: Deletes requirement that students in blended learning course receive online instruction in classroom setting at school.

690.title: Death Penalty
690.description: Deletes provisions providing for death penalty for capital felonies; deletes associated provisions, including provisions relating to representation in death penalty cases, capital collateral representation, jurors in capital cases, prohibiting imposition of death sentence on defendant with mental retardation, determination of whether to impose sentence of death or life imprisonment for capital felony or capital drug trafficking felony, issuance of warrant of execution, stay of execution of death sentence, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be insane, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be pregnant, grounds for death warrant, execution of death sentence, prohibition against reduction of death sentence as result of determination that method of execution is unconstitutional, sentencing orders in capital cases, regulation of execution, transfer to state prison for safekeeping before death warrant issued, return of warrant of execution issued by Governor, sentence of death unexecuted for unjustifiable reasons, & return of warrant of execution issued by Supreme Court.

691.title: Use of Deadly Force in Defense of a Person
691.description: Repeals provisions relating to home protection & use of deadly force, which created presumption of fear of death or great bodily harm in certain circumstances & provided that person has no duty to retreat & has right to stand his or her ground & meet force with force in certain circumstances; conforms provisions.

692.title: Marriage/Issuance of Marriage Licenses to Persons of the Same Sex
692.description: Deletes requirement that marriage license only be issued to one male & one female; deletes provision specifying that term "marriage" in statute or rule means only legal union between one man & one woman as husband & wife & that term "spouse" applies only to member of such union.

693.title: Cannabis
693.description: Removes cannabis from schedule of controlled substances; conforms provisions.

695.title: Compensation for Reporting Tax Law Violations
695.description: Deletes provisions restricting means by which person may seek or obtain compensation for reporting another person's violation of state's tax laws.

696.title: Traffic Infraction Detectors
696.description: Repeals provisions relating to installation & use of traffic infraction detectors to enforce specified provisions when driver fails to stop at traffic signal, provisions that authorize DHSMV, county, or municipality to use such detectors, & provisions for distribution of penalties collected for specified violations.

697.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 396 (Ch. 2016-43)
697.title: Nonresident Plaintiffs in Civil Actions
697.description: Repeals requirement that nonresident plaintiff in civil action post security for costs.

699.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 545 (Ch. 2016-24)
699.title: Prostitution
699.description: Revises definition of term "sexual abuse of a child" to delete references to prostitution offenses.

700.title: Pesticide Registration
700.description: Deletes provisions relating to supplemental registration fees for certain pesticides that contain active ingredients for which EPA has established food tolerance limits.

701.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1083 (Ch. 2016-140)
701.title: Licensure of Facilities and Programs for Persons with Developmental Disabilities
701.description: Abrogates scheduled expiration & reversion of amendments to ss. 393.067(15) & 393.18, F.S.; specifies that AHCA is not required to contract with certain licensed facilities; revises residency limitations for comprehensive transitional education programs.

702.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
702.title: Tax on Sales, Use, and Other Transactions
702.description: Exempts all aircraft sales or leases from sales & use tax.

703.title: Write-in Candidates
703.description: Repeals requirement that write-in candidate reside within district of office sought at time of qualification.

704.title: Failure to Return Hired or Leased Personal Property or Equipment
704.description: Deletes provisions providing criminal penalties for failure to return hired or leased personal property or equipment in certain circumstances; conforms provisions.

705.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
705.title: Vacation Rentals
705.description: Authorizes local laws, ordinances, & regulations to prohibit vacation rentals or regulate duration & frequency of rental of vacation rentals.

706.title: District Cost Differential
706.description: Deletes district cost differential used in determining annual allocation to school districts from FEFP; conforms cross-references & provisions.

708.title: Concealed Weapons and Firearms
708.description: Revises areas of airport where person is prohibited from openly carrying handgun or from carrying concealed weapon or firearm.

709.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
709.title: Tobacco Settlement Agreement
709.description: Repeals security requirements for tobacco settlement agreement signatories, successors, parents, & affiliates.

710.title: School Safety
710.description: Removes provision prohibiting concealed carry licensees from openly carrying handgun or carrying concealed weapon or firearm into elementary or secondary school facility or administration building.

711.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
711.title: Repeal of Advanced Nuclear Cost Recovery
711.description: Repeals provisions for cost recovery mechanisms for siting, design, licensing, & construction of nuclear & integrated gasification combined cycle power plants, including mechanisms that promote utility investment in, & allow for recovery in electric utility rates of certain costs of such plants; repeals provisions relating to financing for certain nuclear generating asset retirement or abandonment costs.

712.title: Admission to Practice Law
712.description: Removes provisions authorizing Supreme Court to admit bar applicant who is an unauthorized immigrant.

713.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
713.title: Resident Status for Tuition Purposes
713.description: Deletes provision that dependent child who is United States citizen may not be denied classification as resident for tuition purposes based solely upon immigration status of his or her parent.

714.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
714.title: Regulation of Smoking
714.description: Repeals preemption to state of regulation of smoking.

715.title: Duties of the Legislative Auditing Committee
715.description: Repeals provisions related to certain duties of Legislative Auditing Committee.

716.title: General Appropriations Act
716.description: Provides moneys for annual period beginning July 1, 2016, & ending June 30, 2017, & supplemental appropriations for period ending June 30, 2016, to pay salaries & other expenses, capital outlay-buildings & other improvements, & for other specified purposes of various agencies of state government.

717.title: Implementing the 2016-2017 General Appropriations Act
717.description: Implements specific appropriations of the General Appropriations Act for the 2016-2017 fiscal year.

718.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-63, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2016-66)
718.title: State-administered Retirement Systems
718.description: Revising required employer retirement contribution rates for each membership class and subclass of the Florida Retirement System; revising the employer assessment rate for offsetting administrative and educational costs related to the Florida Retirement System, etc.

719.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-64, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2016-66)
719.title: Collective Bargaining
719.description: Provides for resolution of collective bargaining issues at impasse between State of Florida & certified bargaining units for state employees pursuant to specified instructions.

721.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-25, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 941 (Ch. 2016-230), HB 5001 (Ch. 2016-66)
721.title: Alzheimer's Disease Research
721.description: Provides for carryforward of any unexpended balance of appropriation for Ed & Ethel Moore Alzheimer's Disease Research Program.

722.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 479 (Ch. 2016-22)
722.title: Special District Accountability
722.description: Requires DEO to exclude inactive special districts from official list of special districts; requires DEO to remove special districts declared inactive from official list of special districts.

723.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-3, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1083 (Ch. 2016-140), HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62), HB 5101 (Ch. 2016-65)
723.title: Individuals with Disabilities
723.description: Establishes Financial Literacy Program for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities within DFS; requires department to develop & implement program in consultation with specified stakeholders; requires qualified public depository to participate in Financial Literacy Program for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities; creates "Employment First Act"; requires specified state agencies & organizations to develop & implement interagency cooperative agreement; requires DEO, in consultation with other entities, to create Florida Unique Abilities Partner Program.

724.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 552 (Ch. 2016-1)
724.title: Environmental Resources
724.description: Provides for conservation lands database; provides assistance to self-suppliers of water; authorizes pilot projects for certain water management districts (WMDs); requires adoption of minimum flows & levels for Outstanding Florida Springs; requires concurrent adoption of recovery or prevention strategies & minimum flows & levels; provides for Central Florida Water Initiative Area; authorizes allocation of water by SFWMD; requires monitoring of consumptive use permits; provides for certain preferred water supply sources; prohibits modification of permitted water allocations; provides priority consideration to certain public-private partnerships for water storage, groundwater recharge, & water quality improvements on private agricultural lands; revises Northern Everglades & Estuaries Protection Program; revises membership qualifications for Harris Chain of Lakes Restoration Council; requires certain funding plans in water resource development work program; authorizes private landowners to assist WMDs; requires promotion of certain cost-share criteria; creates the Florida Springs & Aquifer Protection Act; authorizes funding for nutrient & sediment reduction & conservation pilot projects; revises requirements for basin management action plans; provides treated potable water supply as designated use of surface waters; requires DEP & DACS to assess water resources & conservation lands.

726.last_action: Unfavorable by State Affairs Committee, laid on Table; YEAS 9 NAYS 9
726.title: Local Government Capital Recovery
726.description: Requires municipalities & counties that meet certain thresholds for specified delinquent revenues to issue procurement requests to collect revenues; requires procurement requests be sent to collection agencies; provides requirements for content of procurement requests; provides that certain delinquent revenues be excluded from threshold calculations in certain circumstances; provides that municipalities & counties issuing procurement requests are not required to enter into contractual arrangement; provides exceptions; requires that copies of all bids received be filed with DFS; requires discussion of capital recovery efforts be included in management letter accompanying municipality's or county's annual financial audit report.

727.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 672 (Ch. 2016-2)
727.title: Educational Options
727.description: Creates "Florida Postsecondary Comprehensive Transition Program Act"; establishes student eligibility requirements for enrollment in program; establishes Florida Center for Students with Unique Abilities; establishes Florida Postsecondary Comprehensive Transition Program Scholarship for certain qualified students; authorizes certain school districts and charter schools to be eligible to receive incentive payments for implementing a standard student attire policy that meets certain criteria; revises provisions relating to Florida Personal Learning Scholarship Accounts Program & Florida Tax Credit Scholarship Program; provides appropriations.

728.title: Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission
728.description: Revising penalties for violations of commission rules or regulations relating to control and management of state game lands; prohibiting certain possession of any marine turtle species or hatchling or parts thereof; providing a penalty for violations relating to possession of recreational hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses, permits, and authorization numbers; providing penalties for violations relating to filing reports and documents by persons who hold alligator licenses and permits; revising penalties for the illegal killing, possessing, or capturing of alligators or other crocodilia or their eggs, etc.

729.title: Career and Adult Education
729.description: Revises provisions relating to apprenticeships & job-training programs, high school equivalency programs, Higher Education Coordinating Council, applied technology diploma programs, adult general education programs, CAPE digital tool certificates, & career centers; creates Florida Apprenticeship Grant (FLAG) & Rapid Response Grant programs; provides an appropriation.

730.title: Education Access and Affordability
730.description: Specifying that the costs of instructional materials are not included in tuition for certain online degree programs; requiring the Board of Governors and the State Board of Education to annually identify strategies to promote college affordability; revising provisions relating to textbook affordability to include instructional materials; requiring Florida College System institutions and state universities to provide a public notice relating to increases in tuition and fees, etc.

732.title: Ad Valorem Tax Exemption for Deployed Servicemembers
732.description: Expands military operations that qualify certain servicemembers who receive a homestead exemption & were deployed during previous calendar year to receive additional ad valorem tax exemption on that homestead property; provides procedures for grant of exemption.

733.title: At-risk Vessels
733.description: Prohibits vessels that are at risk of becoming derelict from anchoring on, mooring on, or occupying state waters; authorizes FWCC or specified law enforcement officers to determine that vessels are at risk of becoming derelict if certain conditions exist; provides that persons who anchor or moor or allow such a vessel to occupy state waters commit noncriminal violation; provides for enforcement, penalties, & applicability.

734.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-181, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2016-62), CS/CS/HB 7061 (Ch. 2016-239)
734.title: Department of Transportation
734.description: Revising the minimum amount of funds that the department must request for the Florida Seaport Transportation and Economic Development Program; providing a specified penalty for drivers of commercial motor vehicles who obtain temporary registration permits entering the state at, or operating on designated routes to, a port-of-entry location; authorizing the department to establish a program that would assist small businesses; establishing the Florida Department of Transportation Financing Corporation, etc.

736.title: Marketable Record Titles to Real Property
736.description: Revises exceptions to marketability by including homeowners' association & mandatory property owners' association covenants & restrictions; authorizes mandatory property owners' association to file notice to preserve covenant or restriction; provides exceptions; authorizes certain homeowners' associations & mandatory property owners' associations to revive certain covenants & restrictions that have lapsed.

737.title: OGSR/Emergency Notification Information
737.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for emergency notification information held by agency.

738.title: OGSR/Office of Financial Regulation
738.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for confidential or exempt information received from certain state or federal agencies & information received or developed by OFR in joint or multiagency examination or investigation.

739.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7002 (Ch. 2016-47)
739.title: OGSR/Local Government Audit and Investigative Reports
739.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for certain information related to audit report of internal auditor or investigative report of inspector general prepared for or on behalf of local government unit.

740.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7029 (Ch. 2016-237)
740.title: Extracurricular Activities
740.description: Revises provisions relating to extracurricular activities, interscholastic athletic competitions, & FHSAA; authorizes Education Practices Commission to suspend educator certificates for certain violations relating to recruitment; requires FHSAA to report certain information to DOE; requires DOE staff to advise commissioner of all referrals by FHSAA relating to certain recruiting offenses.

741.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 7024 (Ch. 2016-48)
741.title: OGSR/Florida Center for Brain Tumor Research
741.description: Amends provisions that provide exemption from public records requirements for information held by Florida Center for Brain Tumor Research; removes scheduled repeal of exemption.

743.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1030 (Ch. 2016-8)
743.title: Official Florida Statutes
743.description: Adopts Florida Statutes 2016 & designates portions thereof that are to constitute official law of state; provides that Florida Statutes 2016 shall be effective immediately upon publication; provides that general laws enacted during October 19-November 6, 2015, special session & prior thereto & not included in Florida Statutes 2016 are repealed; provides that general laws enacted after October 19-November 6, 2015, special session are not repealed by this adoption act.

744.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1040 (Ch. 2016-11)
744.title: Florida Statutes/Noncurrent Repeal or Expiration
744.description: Repeals specified provisions that have become inoperative by noncurrent repeal or expiration & may be omitted from 2016 Florida Statutes only through reviser's bill duly enacted by Legislature; conforms povisions.

745.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1038 (Ch. 2016-10)
745.title: Florida Statutes/General
745.description: Deletes provisions that have expired, become obsolete, had their effect, served their purpose, or been impliedly repealed or superseded; replaces incorrect cross-references & citations; corrects grammatical, typographical, & like errors; removes inconsistencies, redundancies, & unnecessary repetition in statutes; improves clarity of statutes & facilitates their correct interpretation; confirms restoration of provisions unintentionally omitted from republication in acts of Legislature during amendatory process & removes gender-specific references applicable to human beings from Florida Statutes without substantive change in legal effect.

746.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1032 (Ch. 2016-9)
746.title: Florida Statutes/Rulemaking
746.description: Conforms Florida Statutes to directive of Legislature in s. 9, ch. 2012-116, LOF, codified as s. 11.242(5)(j), F.S., to prepare reviser's bill to omit all statutes & laws, or parts thereof, which grant duplicative, redundant, or unused rulemaking authority.

747.last_action: Chapter No. 2016-238, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1125 (Ch. 2016-98)
747.title: Early Childhood Development
